"I'm afraid we'll have to finish this quickly. My lunch break is only fifteen minutes and I'd rather spend my time savoring my food than talking with it."

Without further ado she parted her lips and dropped you. Your tiny form was sent flailing downwards towards the hungry abyss that awaited you. You landed upon Ms. Lovelace's slimy tongue with a splat, and immediately the great pink serpent got to work running itself over every inch of your body. She used it to work you through her mouth, rubbing you against the inside of her cheeks. She sucked on you like a candy, drenching your clothes with dog spit. She ran you across her jagged canines and you were terrified that she'd tried to test you further my chewing you with them. Luckily she seemed to prefer her meal whole and intact, and instead she focused on just getting as much flavor as she could out of you before finishing you off.

Ms. Lovelace leaned back in her seat, her massive bulk making the chair creak and threatened to cause it to shatter into splinters. She looked just as emotionless as always. The only sign that she was enjoying her snack at all was her tail involuntarily wagging. If she'd noticed she would've tried to stop it before anyone else could see, but she was too busy slurping away at her treat to realize what she was doing. You were far tastier than the other humans she'd eaten. She found herself hoping you really did survive her insides so she could do this again.

Her tongue kept up the assault on your body for the full fifteen minutes of her lunch break. As soon as it was over she effortlessly maneuvered you to the back of her throat. You tried begging one last time but your plea fell on deaf ears. She swallowed you with a single gulp, sending you plummeting downwards once again. The only difference was that at the end of this free fall you were meant with an ocean of stomach acid instead of a giant pink tongue. You landed in the midst of gastric juices with a pathetic "plop". Your arrival in her stomach was heralded by Ms. Lovelace giving off an involuntary belch.

"UUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPP!"

The force of the burp was so strong it surprised her, actually bringing a slight blush to her otherwise cool face. She was very much grateful that no one was around to witness that. She smacked her lips, tasting you again in her mouth, then adjusted her glasses and started gathering her papers.

The walls of your fleshy prison started moving as Ms. Lovelace got up and left the classroom. The contents of her stomach swayed, carrying you along with them on the waves of gastric juices. You truly hadn't thought things could get any worse than when she started her first lesson, but now, the best thing that could possibly happen to you was that you'd digest in this woman's stomach and be free from your torment. If you survived, you'd only be subjected to more torment.

You were just so exhausted. Every part of your body hurt from the days experiences. You were drained both physically and emotionally, and you wanted nothing more than to just go to sleep and pray you'd wake up in your own bed, this entire ordeal some surreal nightmare. Minutes past and the swaying of the teacher's movements, combined with the overwhelming heat and foul smells of the stomach worked together with your fatigue to make you pass out. Your consciousness sank into blackness as your body sank beneath the tingling surface of the dog woman's stomach acids. Your last thought before you blacked out was gratitude for the reprieve from pain.

Do you survive digestion because you're indestructible?
12231112.title: She Swallows You

122311121.content:
You woke up under a deluge of freezing cold water, sputtering and confused. Your body was run up and down a giant white block the size of a building. For a second you didn't know where you were or what was happening, then you began choking on the suds and realization dawned on you. You were in a gigantic bathroom, in a sink.

Sunlight shined through the windows and birds were singing. It was morning. All your clothes, save for your boxers, were gone. Ms. Lovelace was scrubbing you clean with a bar of soap, and she was doing it none too gently. She was wearing a different outfit from before, a blue shirt and white pants. She wasn't wearing any makeup. How long had you been out?

"Finally awake?" she asked. "I was surprised at how long you've been unconscious. I thought for sure you'd be awake when you came back out."

That's right. You remembered. You'd been swallowed! This evil bitch had actually gone ahead and eaten you alive!

"Wait," you thought feeling queasy. "How did I get out--No. Never mind. I'm not going to think about it. She threw me up. That is what happened. That is what I believe."

"It's been twelve hours since I ate you," Ms. Lovelace said. "It looks like our test was a success. You truly are invincible. Congratulations."

"Yeah, I'm freaking jumping for joy."

"You seem in an awful mood."

"What do I care about being polite?" you shouted at her. "You're just going to do what you want with me anyway, and I already know I'll survive it!"

Ms. Lovelace narrowed her eyes. "You'd do well to keep a civil tongue in that mouth. Just because you can survive anything doesn't mean you won't wish you hadn't."

You couldn't argue with that. Your giant captor scrubbed you even harder with the soap than before. She stopped several minutes later and dried you off with a hand towel the size of a circus tent to you. When she was done, she dropped you carelessly onto the bathroom counter, next to a pair of clothes your size.

"Now that we've determined your endurance, it's time to decide what would be the best place for you." She began applying mascara, not looking at you as she spoke.

"What do you mean?"

"I mean, I have yet to decide if the classroom is really the right fit for you. Once the girls know you're invincible it's unlikely they'll show the necessary restraint in handling you. The entire point of the class is for them to learn how to treat their humans without breaking them. An unbreakable human defeats the purpose, don't you think?"

"So, if you can't use me in your teaching... Does that mean you'll let me go?" you asked hopefully.

"What? Oh, heavens no. Just because you can't be used in my lessons doesn't mean I'll let a perfectly good human go to waste. You'd stay with me, of course. I am certified in the care and handling of humans. There's no one better qualified to look after you than myself."

"You ate me!"

"And you turned out perfectly fine, see?"

You really didn't know which prospect was worse. On the one hand, the girls in the class would've ended up killing you anyway if you weren't invincible, on the other hand, you knew for a fact that Ms. Lovelace didn't care at all about your wellbeing. While the students were careless, the teacher was evil! There may also be the possibility that a student might take pity on you. Maybe one would be open to helping you escape from this terrible place. Either way, the choice was out of your hands entirely. Ms. Lovelace was the one who'd ultimately decide what's to be done with you.

Does Ms. Lovelace return you to school as a human test dummy, or does she keep you for herself?
122311121.title: You're Indestructible So You Survive

choices: Chip isn't found in the log.
Chip is found in the log!
Chip isn't found but the pig girls remain in the area.
123.content:
Chip went through the motions driving to his after school job. It was his senior year and he was now legally an adult which meant things were about to get expensive. Being that he lived in a small pig farming town most jobs required lots of work and low pay. However recently some sort of disgraced physicist on the edge of his town sent out an ad for a lab assistant that paid well above minimum wage. Luckily he saw this early, applied, and received the job after signing a confidentiality contract.

Things had been boring, Chip mostly just filmed him giving audible journal logues about scientific nonsense and carried heavy equipment. He wasn't even supposed to work today but his employer was adamant. Chip entered the laboratory and saw that the lights were off and it was empty. There was also what looked like a large 1950s ray gun propped up on a stand. He walked over to it and saw a sticky note that read "Warning Time Machine, that's right Time Machine! Only prototype. Malfunctioning. Went out for proper tools. Please don't touch!" Chip couldn't believe what he was reading, his employer actually believes that he built a time machine. He rolled his eyes and flicked the light switch on. The lights came on but so did the ray gun, it glowed a neon green and was pointing at Chip. Before he could react a mechanical voice said "future" then shot a green bolt of lightning at him that caused his body to explode into a million little particles

Chip was disoriented as his vision was emerald static chaos. Then he could see the world again and the particles reassembled his body in the middle of a field. He shook as he was in unfamiliar territory but then noticed something familiar, his town, with one big difference. All of the buildings were a lot bigger, big enough to house something 10 times as big as a human being. He started to wonder if the machine in the lab was a shrink ray not a time machine, that didnt link up though since the plants were the same sizes.

Just then someone ran into Chip. It was a guy around his age except his clothes were rags and his facial hair is long and unkempt, that was panting like crazy. "Hey what-!" Chip tried to say before the man ran away screaming "Run for your freedom brother!". He was confused over what he said then looked where he ran from and couldn't believe his eyes. Over the ridge three 10 foot tall obese pig ladies were sprinting in his direction. The jiggling mounds of flesh terrified him beyond belief. Their rumps were massive each cheek as tall as he was, there breasts were so large that their bra size went well beyond the alphabet in size, with a cleavage that he could easily disappear into. He jumped up and ran away toward the forest the other guy ran towards.

Chip ran as fast as he could dodging branches and leaping over bushes. Meanwhile behind him the ground shook and the plantlife was steamrolled behind him. He saw the man from before climbing a tree and he thought he should hide as well. Frantically searching, he found a hollowed out log and crawled inside it.

What happens next?
123.title: Time Travel

13.content:
Outside a small, coastal village in the south, a group of guards marched you to a nearby cliff overlooking the ocean. Your hands were bound behind your back and a gag was placed in your mouth. The guards surrounding you were jittery, looking at you like they expected you to make a mad dash at any moment, and to be perfectly fair, you had done so several times in the hour you'd spent marching only to be pummeled into submission. After the fifth time you couldn't see the point any longer.

The plump, middle-aged priestess who was in charge of the guards stood nearby as you marched.

"I can tell you're not happy about this," she said.

You shot her a death glare in response.

"But still, the village really appreciates the sacrifice you're making today. I know it's not ideal, but who knows? Maybe the Ocean Goddess will be a fair mistress? After all, she offered the village her eternal protection in exchange for one soul to claim for herself. That's a remarkably good deal for us! Not so much for you but... um..." she coughed awkwardly. "Look, it wasn't easy making a decision! We didn't know what to do! It's not everyday an animal goddess appears out of the blue and offers to make a divine pact! I mean, you saw the size of her. Who would refuse someone that big? Besides, who knows what disasters could be avoided by her protection? And it wasn't like you were doing much in your life, shirking off work, mooching off your parents, I mean, you're twenty years old! It's about time you did something with your life... Or rather, for someone to do something with your life."

Even behind your gag she could make out the string of curses you threw at her. She blushed in shock, and a nearby guard whacked you on the back of your head to get you to shut up.

"Don't talk to the priestess like that, boy!" he snapped.

You merely growled in response. This whole situation was unfair! One day you had just been living your life and the next your entire village, even your own family, had eagerly offered you up to some titanic behemoth! You had seen her only once before, when she had first made her offer to the village. It didn't help that the way she worded it could've meant either slavery or death.

Eventually, your group reached their destination, and you were marched onto a stone slab on the cliff's edge, the ocean simmering far below you. Short of making a suicidal leap, there was no way out of this. You were brought to your knees and tied down.

Next to you, the fat priestess intoned, "Oh noble, ocean goddess who has offered us your everlasting protection, we have come before you today to seal the pact between our village and your divine form. As promised, in exchange we offer you this meager, meager, meager sacrifice to do with as you wish. Whether that be to devour him alive, enslave him eternally in the celestial realm, or subject him to tortures too horrible for us mere mortals to even contemplate--"

"STOP GIVING HER SUGGESTIONS!" you shouted through your gag. Only the fact that this was a divine ceremony protected you from another blow from a guard.

The priestess coughed. "Yes, well, um... In the words of The Priestess of the Anthro Pantheon, "He's all yours, boss."

The ocean started bubbling, and the ground started to shake. The guards looked at each other nervously but were too frightened to move. The weight of the situation hitting you, you started struggling against your restraints, but to no avail. A blinding circle of white light shined on the sea, and a second later the goddess emerged from the depths of the ocean with a tremendous explosion of water. You gulped as you saw her gigantic form. She was just as massive as you remembered.

She was an obese, whale giantess who stood head and shoulders over the mountain. Her skin was sapphire blue and it shimmered in the light of the sun from the water coating her body. She wore a black toga that could barely contained the massive swell of her chest or her colossal ass, which seemed large enough to crush half of your village. She wore pink eye shadow, and had pink hair that was drawn back into a braid that stretched down past her shoulders. She wore a gold tiara inlaid with pearls over the small fin on top of her head.

Immediately her sea-green eyes locked onto your miniscule form, and her ruby red lips formed a wicked smirk. Her name... was Pearl.

"Oh yes," she said in a haughty contralto, "this one will do quite nicely." You shivered as he licked her lips.

The priestess coughed to gain her goddess's attention. "So... do we have an agreement?"

"Hmm? Oh, yes, yes. Eternal protection, blah, blah, blah. Now run along back to your little village, while this little man and I attend to matters."

The priestess and guards quickly complied, scurrying away and not even sparing you a backwards glance. "Bastards," you thought. Your attention was quickly drawn back to your more immediate problem as you felt Pearl's gaze on you again.

"Well my little sacrifice, don't you just look positively scrumptious."

The way she said it, you couldn't tell if she meant this hungrily or lustfully. Either way, you were terrified and tried vainly to escape your bonds again.

"Allow me to help with that."

Pearl raised her pinkie finger and used the tip of a pink nail to slice the ropes holding you. Your freedom lasted less than a millisecond before she plucked you up between two fingers with a speed and careful muscle control that you wouldn't have believed from something her size. She brought you before one giant eye and giggled.

"You look even better up close, handsome. Now, let's say we make our way back to my celestial realm and get working on... what was it your priestess called it? Oh right! "Tortures too horrible for mortals to even contemplate.""

You had no idea whether she was serious or not, but you had no intention to find out. You struggled pointlessly in her grip and Pearl giggled at your pathetic display.

"I recommend holding your breath," she said.

You weren't able to process this quickly enough, but with a dawning terror you realized what she meant as the water surrounding Pearl glowed with a blinding white light. There wasn't even enough time for you to cry out as Pearl descended back into the ocean, dragging you out of the mortal world and into her celestial realm.
13.title: A Goddess's Sacrifice

131.content:
Minutes later, you and Pearl emerged into her realm. You were finally able to rip the gag out of your mouth as you gasped for air and coughed up water. You were soaking wet and shivering from the cold, but Pearl was perfectly fine. "Home sweet home," she said.

Pearl's home looked like a two-story penthouse apartment built inside of an aquarium. The walls, floor and ceiling were made out of a light purple coral, and the huge windows outside gave view to the vastness of the ocean. Colorful fish and other forms of aquatic life you never knew existed swam by. The lamps gave off sea-green light. The place was decorated with sea shells and maritime equipment, it even had some clams and anemones. A luxurious hot tub was in her living room, bubbling away before a large, flatscreen tv.

"Not bad, eh, my little sacrifice?" she asked.

"It--It's really quite lovely," you choked out, not wanting to offend the behemoth who held you between her two fingers. "You have impeccable taste... ma'am?" you said, not quite sure how to address a literal goddess.

Pearl smiled at that all the same. She walked over to her hot tub and suspended you over a pink anemone. She dropped you into it, and immediately the wiggling tentacle bits wrapped around you, leaving only your head free. They tingled uncomfortably. Pearl winked at you then disrobed, revealing the black bikini she wore underneath her toga. She lowered herself into the bubbling water. She reached over to a nearby bottle of red wine and poured herself a glass.

She sipped at her glass and let out a contented sigh afterwards. "This is the life," she said. "Did you know this hot tub is heated by an underwater volcano?"

"Fascinating," you said. "Um, listen... ma'am," you said, not quite knowing how to address a literal goddess, "there's been a big misunderstanding. I never agreed to be sacrificed. So if you could just let me go, I'd be really grateful! You can even enslave my old village for lying to you, if you'd like!"

Pearl chuckled, "Oh, aren't you precious? No one chooses to be sacrificed, my scrumptious friend. At least, most don't. And I won't lie. If any of the volunteers knew what some of us goddesses did to them, they'd probably withdraw that offer instantly."

You gulped. "Um... Wh--What do you do to them?"

"Me?" Pearl said. "Oh nothing yet! I just got promoted to this gig, wasn't authorized to have a sacrifice bequeathed to me before. You're my first. Aren't you the lucky one?" she said, wiggling her eyebrows suggestively.

You laughed, more in fear than amusement. "YEP!" you choked out. "Lucky, lucky! Honestly though, I feel like I'm not... um--worthy! Of the honor! If you'd like to put me back I'd completely understand!"

Pearl rolled her eyes and snapped her fingers. You yelped as the anemone gave you an unpleasant shock.

"Please give up thoughts of escape, dear. That will grow tiring quickly, and I'm afraid I'll have to punish you if you annoy me. Don't worry though, in my realm you're unable to die unless I allow it. So you'll be able to survive even the most excruciating of torments." She said this last part like it was seriously a great comfort to you. "Which is lucky, because I have big plans for you."

"What?!" you blurted out. "What plans?!"

She eyed you, smiling.

"Well, my little sacrifice, it was very important that I retrieved a mortal soul. I need you for a very important purpose. I need you as a...
131.title: A Sacrifice's Destiny

choices: "Invite my friends over and show you off!"
"Actually, let's just chat and get to know each other."
"Treat myself to that...guilty pleasure I mentioned.." >:)
1311.content:
"I'm just going to be honest with you; you deserve that much after being dragged out and sacrificed like that." Pearl clears her throat, "You are going to be my personal pet and plaything. Basically someone to practice and play with between my duties as a goddess."

"WHAT?!?" you bellow, surprising yourself with how loud you were. "I'm just some toy for you to lord over?!"

Pearl sighed, setting her wine glass aside. "More like a cute pet to play with, but...yes, my little sacrifice. That's your lot in life now." She reached over and plucked you out of the anemone, holding you close to her face. "Look, I'm new to this 'goddess' thing; I haven't really adjusted yet. I'm the Goddess of the Oceans; that's half of your mortal planet! That's a big workload!"

"Seventy percent of the planet...." you mumble. Apparently this so-called "Goddess" hadn't looked at a globe.

Pearl either didn't hear your snark, or ignored it. "And this is the first time I've really interacted with humans. I mean, my parents gave me some pirates and other bad guys to play with when I was a little kid, but...I just ate or sat on them when I got bored. They deserved it, but that's not the same thing as having to protect a whole village of humans."

Despite Pearl's rambling, you cringe. She was just so casual when she talked about the poor saps she'd eaten alive or crushed when they weren't amusing any more...and she'd done that as a kid!

"So I need...practice. A human who's around all the time, so I can finally get the 'lording over mortals' thing down. The voice, how to give orders; all that," Pearl concluded. Then she smirked. "And when the job gets stressful, I'll also need some...stress relief. A nice fin massage; or just chase around.....maybe even sit on you, if I'm in that sort of mood." She winked, shaking her hips under the water and making waves. "But don't worry, that's more of a guilty pleasure now that I've grown up. Mostly."

You began to sweat. Just what was this giant whale woman going to do to you? It sounded like you'd be her adviser half the time; her helpless toy the other half!

Pearl giggled at your bewilderment and finished off her wine. "Well, it looks like I'm getting the 'show mortals their place' part of the job down pat." She lumbered out of the jacuzzi and set you on the tub's rim as she toweled off. Not bothering to put her toga back on, she snatched you up again. "Well, my little sacrifice; I think it's time we celebrate my promotion to goddesshood, and your new lease on life!" She announced cheerfully. "And I know just the way to do it. I'm gonna..."
1311.title: Brutal Honesty

choices: Go meet up with some of my friends?
13112.content:
"Wait, really?" you ask doubtfully, "Why would you want to know about me?"

Pearl rolled her eyes, "Because were going to be living together for quite some time now, and it would help if we both weren't total strangers." She walked over to her couch and sat down, casing an eruption of groans from the poor furniture.

"Can't you get furniture that is more suited to your...size?" you remark as she sets you down next to her bulbous thigh.

"I like having things break under me." she replied casually, shifting herself to get more comfortable. The couch moaned once again, but it still manged to stay up. "So" She turns to face you, "Tell me about yourself.".

Well, you did. For the next hour and half all the two of you did was talk and get to know each other. Your life has been hard, and particularly unkind. Your parents died when you were a kid, leaving you an orphan, which was for some reason looked down upon in the prehistoric village. You was smart, but you never really got the chance to apply my ideas. You told Pearl why your were chosen, because you were a bachelor, and she looked at you curiously.

"How old are you?" Pearl asks in response.

"21 Years." you reply causally.

Pearl then scowls, "So this head priestess lady chose you because you weren't married yet? That has to be the stupidest reason to be a sacrifice i ever heard!" She huffs and crosses her pudgy arms around her bosom. "Geeze, I thought at least you did something bad to deserve this, but...because you don't have a girlfriend!?"

Pearl surprised you with how much fuss she was going over about yourself. Your first impression of her was that she was a bored, if not sadistic young adult who just wanted a plaything. But seeing her right now...It made the prospect of being a slave a little more appealing. Relatively, anyway.

"...If I may ask?" her voice become a bit serious. "Do you ever want to get married? I mean, not now because your my slave and everything, but you know...later."

You stiffen up a bit at this question. You really hoped she wouldn't ask something like this. "I'm....I'm afraid of love." You explain, which gets a puzzled face from Pearl. "Im afraid of falling in live with someone, actually feel about them, get married...and lose interest. I don't want the love to just fade away as the years go by and be stuck in a hollow shell of something that was once beautiful."

"...Wow". Pearl says after a moment of silence, "That was deep."

"Thanks." You smile a bit. It was the first time you felt happy today. "So, what's your story?" You say, felling a bit more causal around your new mistress.

It turns out that her life was exceptionally better then yours. The only complaints she had about it were typical first world problems. You were actually really intrigued in her backstory. You cringed a bit when she casually mentioned eating a bunch of pirates alive, but other then that she seemed like a fairly nice person.

"Well, now that we've got that out of the way," Pearl grabs you and lifts you off the couch, but you don't struggle. Not because you were afraid of her, but you genuinely felt safe being around her. She gets up and the couch spring back to life, happy to have the weight taken off it.

"...Why don't we...?"
13112.title: "Actually, let's just chat and get to k...

1312.content:
"The what?!"

"The Goddess Games," Pearl repeated. "It's an annual event held by the entire pantheon! Once a year, we goddesses gather together, chose a human champion, and give them a series of challenges to complete. Then, a panel of judges decides which performance was best. The goddess whose champion gets the highest score wins!" Pearl sighed dreamily. "Oh it's so wonderful, the winner gets a fame, fortune, and eternal glory as their name is inscribed on the Wall of Champions!"

"I'd get all that?" you ask.

Pearl laughed in your face. "No, silly! The winning goddess gets that!"

You crossed your arms in a huff, "So what does the winning mortal get?"

"A participation ribbon."

"Are you kidding me?! You could at least send me home if I win!"

Pearl sighed, as if pitying you. "I told you, darling. There's no going home. No mortal ever returns after being taken to the heavens. We can't let them leave, knowing what they know about us. People would lose all respect for us if they knew that even a goddess needs to break wind every now and then. I'll tell you what, I don't want a miserable mortal for a slave. If you compete in the games and really give it your all, I promise that I'll make your servitude here as happy as reasonably possible."

"That's it?" you huffed. "That's all you're offering?! "Happy" slavery? What a joke."

Pearl narrowed her eyes. "I could always make it unhappy slavery if you prefer."

There was something about the way she said it, along with a cold glimmer in her eyes hinting at buried cruelty that made you not want to press her on this. You sighed. "So I just have to fight a bunch of humans? That's not so bad."

Pearl smirked. "Well there is one correction, darling, you don't actually fight against any humans. They're just the ones whose scores you need to beat. Mortals fight the goddesses!"

"WHAT?!"

"Well, not technically fight. At least not usually. Each challenge is devised by a goddess and rarely is one of us cruel enough to set you up in an actual fight. Instead it's just a series of games where you need to best us in some way. If you do well, you'll be fine! If not, then you'll probably be humiliated, squashed or eaten. But that just gives you all the more incentive to persevere!"

"Are you kidding me?! No way am I going to do that! You can find yourself another dupe, cause--YOOOOWCH!"

With a snap of her fingers, the anemone shocked you again. It felt ten times as painful as it was before. That immediately shut you up.

"Like I said," Pearl said, clearly at the end of her patience. "All you have to do is compete. You're immortal. You'll survive. Keep mouthing off, and that immortality will go away fast. Ever wonder what happens when you disappear from the heavens? The demonesses in charge of the infernal realm would be more than happy to educate you. This is the first Goddess Games I'm able to compete in and I only just managed to get promoted in time. I'm not going to have my first games ruined by an uppity mortal. Understand?"

You nodded.

"Good," Pearl said. In an instant, the composed, regal goddess who had first collected you reappeared. She reclined in her hot tub, sipping her wine, serenely. "We'll have a week to train. All I ask is you do your best. No pressure."

A week passed, and it was not a fun experience for you. Pearl tried to cram a year's worth of training into seven days, and it easily became seven days of hell. You'd never been the most coordinated person, sports, hell, even physical labor were a strain for you. Unfortunately, in the practice games Pearl devised based on previous events, this resulted in a lot of you being stomped, sat on, eaten, and, in one memorable occasion, used as a literal hacky-sack. Because of your immortality, you survived each game, but somehow the pain and humiliation of each event never lessened. Being eaten the tenth time was just as bad as being eaten the first. Seeing your lack of progress, Pearl became even more dedicated to working you harder to gain improvement. The games became more brutal. However, by week's end the only thing that had been accomplished is that you ached all over and were only slightly less of an embarrassment than you first started. Pearl's assurances of, "Do your best. No pressure," came as more of a mantra directed to keep her spirits up than to help you.

Finally, when the week was done, you both departed to the Coliseum where the games were being held. It must've been packed, because you could hear the roar of the crowd from outside. Pearl walked the steps, carrying you delicately. You didn't know which of you was more nervous, you or her.

"No pressure, no pressure, no pressure," Pearl murmured.

As she neared the entrance, three figures appeared, breaking out of the shadows. They were goddesses, all, and all of them were built like Pearl, obese, large chested and fat-assed. The only difference is that these goddesses were bigger than Pearl! You would never have imagined in your wildest dreams that Pearl would be the runt of the goddess litter.

The leader of the three figures, the tallest and fattest, a golden-skinned dragoness in a red toga approached Pearl. Not only were her shoulders over Pearl's head, but her long neck made her even taller. Even her jewelry looked bigger and fancier than Pearl's. The dragoness tossed her long, midnight-black hair over her shoulder, narrowed her heavily mascared eyes, and smiled her ruby-red lips in a false sweetness, showing off giant, surprisingly white fangs.

"Pearl!" the dragoness said in faked joy. "You made it! I'm so happy! When I heard you'd been promoted, I couldn't believe my ears. Little guppy Pearl, all grown up and part of the pantheon!"

"H-hello, Dracana," Pearl mumbled.

You recognized that name. It was the name of the goddess of the sky.

"Easy girl," Dracana said. "No need to be nervous, you're among friends here! And is that your human? He's so precious and widdle! I just wanna eat him up! And maybe I'll get my chance. Fingers crossed right?" she said, and her two friends giggled sycophantically behind her. "This is, of course, Romulus, he's been the champion of the last three games, as you know."

You hadn't even seen the human confidently standing in the palm of Dracana's hand. He was as giant to you, as his mistress was to yours. Only where Dracana's bulk came from fat, Romulus's came from more muscles than you could imagine. He surveyed you imperiously and made a throat-slitting motion afterwards.

"Well, I'm sure your little fella still has a shot. It's not like you're still that that awkward little girl back in school. Sure, some people say you only got promoted to improve relations with hell after your sister became ruler, but we know better don't we?"

"Y-yes, Dracana."

"Hmm. Well, it was great seeing you again. Good luck in the games, not that you'll need it with such a strapping specimen."

Dracana walked off with her friends, all three giggling as they entered the Coliseum. Pearl breathed deeply for a minute. Finally you worked up the courage to ask, "Pearl? Are you ok--

"WE'RE BEATING THAT SMUG BITCH!"

You flinched at her sudden outburst. "What?! But Pearl, you said no pressure!"

"FUCK IT! LOTS OF PRESSURE! TONS OF PRESSURE! I earned this position! I'm in charge of the ocean! I cover 75% of the planet for crying out loud! I can't help it if my sister conquered hell!"

"Pearl, calm d--"

"DON'T TELL ME TO KEP CALM! I swear, if you don't help me put that overgrown crocodile in her place, you're gonna wish I sent you to hell!"

Before you could argue more, trumpets sounded, signaling the start of the games. Pearl cursed and rushed in, carrying you along roughly. This was gonna be awful. Pearl just managed to get to her spot on stage with the rest of the goddesses as the announcer announced the first event. What was it?
1312.title: Champion for the Goddess Games

choices: No, you fall and get eaten
13121.content:
After the name of the game was announced, the ring in the center of the Coliseum opened up, and a red, cushioned kline, a type of reclining couch used for eating, rose up on an elevator. This kline was different though, a golden arm was attached to it, and was suspended over where a person's head would be. Next to the couch was a table with a bowl on top, filled with bunches of grapes.

"Would the earth goddess, Lila, come to the center of the arena please stage please?"

You had a bad feeling as one of Dracana's two cronies marched off the stage. The earth goddess was a gigantic, green-skinned sow with blue hair, decorated with flowers. As she marched to the center of the Coliseum, the crowd cheered and giant screens hanging on the walls, zoomed in on her as she waved at the crowd. Her human, a kind from the same stock as Romulus, stood fear-free on her shoulder. You noticed a pair of pink boots on his feet, making an otherwise serious-looking man, look kind of ridiculous.

The announcer explained the rules of the game as Lila neared the center. "This game was submitted by Lila. As custom, she and her human will go first. The rules of this game are simple, each mortal will be suspended over Lila's mouth and try to feed her as many grapes as possible while an hour glass counts down. The challenge is over once all the sand, or all the grapes, run out. Or, if the poor, little mortal falls, in which case..."

The announcer paused and Lila chomped her teeth, causing the crowd to go wild.

"As always, goddesses are reminded not to go easy on their mortals, or they will be banned from future games."

Lila rolled her eyes and attached her grapes to the golden hand over the couch. She then plucked her mortal off her shoulder and put him on top of her snack, laying down afterwards and opening her mouth. The camera closed-in on her mortal, but he still seemed remarkably carefree. Presumably they had practiced this themselves.

"Three, two, one..." the announcer called.

BANG! A gunshot went off and the announcer said, "GO!"

Lila's tiny human scurried amidst the grapes. You were surprised at the level of skill he showed, climbing down grapes the size of boulders until he reached the bottom. After getting a sturdy hold on the branch, the small man began stomping on a grape, his mistress's mouth, eagerly anticipating a fruity snack. You were amazed that within two solid kicks, the grape disconnected and disappeared down her gullet. How strong was this guy?! Steadily the human went from grape to grape, stomped on it to send it falling to his mistress, then moved on. He was making remarkable time too. You wondered if he would succeed in actually feeding her the entire bunch when he landed on one grape, only for it to snap before he could get a steadily hold.

Man and grape plummeted, but even as he fell the mortal didn't scream at all. You pitied the poor bastard, even if his defeat meant good things for you. Even if being digested was survivable, it wasn't exactly a pain free process. You needn't have bothered worrying about him. As his mistress's mouth loomed beneath him, the man clicked the heels of his pink boots together and he took flight. Lila's teeth chomped beneath him, but the man was out of reach and flying back to the bunch, where he resumed his grape stomping.

You watched the whole thing dumbfounded.

"MAGIC?! HE CAN DO MAGIC?!"

"Don't be stupid," Pearl said. "Humans can't perform magic... They can use magical artifacts, though. And the rules don't forbid them outright, only limits them to one per human. It gives mortals a fighting chance."

"WELL WHY DIDN'T YOU GIVE ME ONE?!"

"Don't you think I tried?!" Pearl snapped. "I told you I only just got qualified for these games! They were all sold out, so you're just gonna have to do this the hard way."

You felt nauseous as your fellow champion finished the challenge. By the time the game was over, three-quarters of the bunch had vanished into his mistress's gut. The five judges calculated his score, and the screens displayed 38 points. Lila shrugged then got her human out of the grapes and placed him on the table, where he bowed.

"Okay, relax," you told yourself. "You'll just watch the other competitors and use them to come up with a strategy. You'll have plenty of time."

"Now for our next contestant," the announcer said. "A newcomer to the Goddess Games, ladies, please welcome the ocean goddess, Pearl!"

"OH FOR FUCK'S SAKE!" you screamed involuntarily.

Apparently, the sound system was better than you thought as your voice rang out in the Coliseum. The crowd and fellow contestants laughed, Dracana loudest of all. Pearl blushed, shooting you a furious glare. You flinched at the intensity of her glare. She marched quickly offstage, replaced the half-eaten grapes with a fresh bunch, and placed you inside them.

"Thanks, Guppy," Lila said to Pearl. "He looks delicious!" she said, licking her lips.

You shuddered and Pearl put her face near your insignificant body. "Don't. Blow this," she murmured then went back on stage.

"Ok," you said to yourself in a panic. "I can do this! No problem! No problem at all! Worst case scenario, if I fail I'll just be in for an eternity of suffering at the hands of a vengeful goddess... I need to lie down."

Before you could though, the gun went off nearly giving you a heart attack from the sound. You were on a grape at the top of the bunch and for a couple seconds you weren't sure what to do. The crowd jeered you're lack of movement, and beneath you, Lila said, "Hurry up, shrimp, I'm wasting away down here! Get to feeding me! Unless you just wanna hope in right now?" Lila opened her mouth and stuck her tongue out obscenely.

You slapped yourself to regain your composure and, with no better plan in place, you began stomping on the grape you were on just as Lila's human had. You figured those boots must have enhanced his strength as well as giving him the ability to fly, because it was much harder for you to dislodge a grape than it was for him. Either that or you really were this much of a weakling. After ten stomps, finally the damn thing gave way. Unfortunately for you, the grape didn't land on Lila's face, it bounced off its fellow and landed on her cheek, then rolled off and fell on the floor. Judging from the boos of the crowd, you figured that meant it wouldn't count. Lila rolled her eyes. Not a strong start.

You remembered how Lila's human had started at the top, but began feeding her from the bottom of the bunch. You began crawling down to mimic his pattern. Unlike Lila's champion, however, you had no magic, flying boots, so the fear of falling and being devoured was much more real to you than it had been to him. You made your way cautiously downwards, all while hearing the jeers of the crowd. After what felt like several minutes you reached the bottom. You were already exhausted from the climb and had no idea how much time you had left. Dripping with sweat, you wrapped your arms around the vine for a good hold then began stomping on the grape. The good news was that this grape came away at only two kicks. The bad news was that you weren't prepared for deliberately kicking your "floor" out from under you, and began sliding down the vine as the grape fell, your sweat-slick hands and arms giving you poor purchase. You eventually came to a stop, but only at the very edge of the vine, your legs kicking in thin air.

Beneath you, Lila loudly chomped on her grape. A second later.

"UUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPP!"

The sow let loose a mighty belch that stank of grapes. The sound shook you, and the smell made you dizzy. Lila smacked her lips. "Great appetizer... Now how about a little protein?"

Only the abject humiliation of breaking down crying in front of the entire pantheon stopped you from doing just that. For a wild instant you wondered if you should just let go and get it over with. Who knows, maybe you could make a comeback in the next round? You looked to your side and saw Pearl's face on the arena screen. One look at that was enough to get you to reconsider. Who knows what she'd do if you just gave up.

Slowly, painfully slowly, you began climbing back up the vine. The crowd was going impatient as they quickly took up the chant of, "EAT HIM! EAT HIM! EAT HIM!"

"I hate the gods," you mutter.

Just then you reached up, only for your hand to give way. You start sliding back down and let out a panicked cry as Lila opened wide.

Can you stop yourself and survive the challenge?
13121.title: Feed the Goddess

131212.content:
The gods clearly weren't smiling upon you, and in this case you knew that to be a factual statement. You tried to keep a tight hold of the vine, but you were too slippery, and soon you were holding nothing but air. You screamed as you were in free fall. For the first time since this round started, Lila looked actually excited as her tiny mortal, morsel fell to her awaiting maw.

You landed on Lila's tongue with a wet "thwack." You had already been aching from Pearl's training regime, and exhausted from the mere act of trying to dislodge grapes, but now any feeble remnants of strength you had left were exhausted from your rough landing. You knew you should try to escape, if for no other reason than to let Pearl know you were at least trying to do your best, but you were just too weak.

Even if Pearl wouldn't be happy with the situation, you knew for a fact that Lila was. "Mmmmmmmm," her voice rang around you, as she retracted her tongue into her mouth. Her mouth stank of grapes, and you were quickly tossed around inside her mouth as if you were nothing, and to literal gods, you clearly weren't. Lila's tongue smacked you around your mouth and she kept letting out moans of delight. You got the feeling that Lila was playing this up for the crowd. Every once and a while she would open her mouth and stick out her tongue, and in those few moments you could see your disheveled and battered form atop her tongue on the screens around the Coliseum. The other goddesses clearly thought your plight was hilarious. Each time afterwards, Lila would suck her tongue back in and work you around the inside of her mouth again, tasting you all the while.

After several minutes, you could hear the announcer say, "While we appreciate the enthusiasm of our participants, we'd like to remind them that we are on a bit of a schedule."

Lila didn't need any other prodding. With a casual flick of her tongue you went flying down her throat. You couldn't even muster the energy to scream. You landed in her stomach, grapes floating in gastric juices like buoys. Just like in Pearl's stomach, the acids burned but weren't killing you. You worked your way onto a grape, and laid there exhausted.

"OooARRRRRRPPP!" you heard Lila burp, signaling your total defeat.

You were too tired to even care at this point, you just hoped Lila would let you out soon but as the minutes passed you knew that wouldn't be happening. After a while, grapes steadily began joining you in your captor's stomach, each one acting as a new life raft as your previous ones sank into the bubbling juices. It became quickly apparent that Lila wouldn't be releasing you until this challenge was completely over. Unfortunately, the stomach never rested. The grapes fell, threatening to crush you, and sending the ocean of gastric juices roiling like an ocean. You began counting the minutes as you were trapped. An hour eventually passed and not once did another human join you in Lila's stomach. After spending the entire time alternating between soaking in stomach acids and avoiding falling fruits the size of boulders lying on half-eaten pieces of fruit, you heard a last gunshot outside. You felt tremors as the stomach sloshed around you, completely submerging you beneath the waves. Lila was getting up!

Without warning you appeared back outside the gigantic sow, gasping and choking for air as you landed on the table. The other contestants were around you. Some looked at you with pity, others with disdain.

"And here's our newest champion, the poor little fella. Maybe he should've waited longer before playing in the big leagues. Better luck next time, champ!" the announcer said. "And with that, the first game is over. We'll give our contestants ten minutes before we start the next game!"

You felt the tremors as each goddess walked over to the table and retrieve their champion, some giggled as they did and you knew they were laughing at you. As Lila collected her mortal, she winked at you and blew you a kiss. "Thanks for the snack, champ! I hope we can do this again some time!"

You groaned and said nothing. Pearl eventually retrieved you and none too gently. As you walked away she hissed, "What the hell was that?"

"What did you expect?!" you said, outraged. "I've had a week's worth of training and no magical items to help me!"

"Well you better get your act together!" she said. "Do you know what your score was? A TWO! And Romulus got a 50 out of 50! He fed Lila every single grape in his bunch and he didn't even need to use his magic item!"

"Well I'm sorry I can't be as perfect as Romulus!"

"Just get your head in the game, little man. Otherwise there's going to be dire consequences."

You didn't bother arguing any more. She was clearly past reason. Eventually the goddesses gathered on stage, and the announcer called the next game, which was...
131212.title: No, you fall and get eaten

1312121.content:
"The Seat Sprint!" the announcer called out. Once again, in the center of the arena, the ring opened up and the bowl of grapes, table and kline were all lowered back underground. The ring was still open though, and a minute later a huge couch came up instead.

You started to groan only to stop abruptly. You knew this game from training with Pearl. Why wouldn't you? Pearl was the one who came up with it. You remembered the rules as the announcer told them for the crowd. It was a simple game really. Champions were placed at one end of the couch, Pearl stood in the middle, and the champion only had a minute to sprint across the couch before Pearl sat down and squashed him. As you thought about it, you actually smirked. This was one of the only challenges that you didn't completely stink at! Granted it hadn't started out that way, the first few times you did this game, Pearl's colossal behind had fallen on top of you like a moon crashing into the earth.

"This is your game!" you'd snapped after the sixth squashing. "Just change it for a new one!"

"If I could, I would," Pearl said, at the end of her patience, "but the paperwork's already been filled out and this is the game I came up with! I invented it because I thought it was the simplest challenge for whatever sacrifice I got! All you have to do is make it to the end! Just run!"

So you'd run, each time getting a little bit better. Eventually you managed to reach the other end of the couch with some time to spare. It was the only few times Pearl had ever shown pride in you.

'I can do this!' you thought as Pearl carried you over to the couch. Sure you were still sore from the last challenge, but this one wouldn't be so bad. You could beat this one, no problem! You kept that cocky attitude until you both reached the couch. There was one problem. This couch was longer than the one you'd been practicing on.

"Pearl," you said nervously, "this couch isn't the same size as the one at home."

"I know," Pearl said. "I don't understand, I used my couch as a model. It should be the same size."

"Did you measure it right?"

"Of course I measured it right! I did it three times to be sure!"

"Well what do we do?!"

"Same thing as you did in training. You beat this challenge. Or else."

You gulped as Pearl put you on one side of the couch and nervously stood in the center. You awkwardly knelt, ready to run. You had a clear view of the timer of one minute in front of you.

"Get ready! On your mark... get set... GO!"

There was a bang and you were off, sprinting as fast as you possibly could across the leather of the couch. Pearl's behind loomed over you like a mountain. You remembered the pressure and pain of feeling Pearl sit on you during training. That threat, along with the threat of everything else Pearl might do to you if you lost this competition, propelled you onward. As you ran you noticed that laughs were coming from the audience. You blushed as you realized this. 'No wonder,' you thought, 'I must look ridiculous! Like an ant trying to crawl as fast as it can!' You tried to push the embarrassment aside and put your full attention into running. Your body was not pleased, as all the battery it'd been subjected to earlier made every step painful. But through it all you just kept running. It seemed to be paying off. Even though the timer was counting down, you were halfway to the end. Maybe you'd finally be able to win a challenge?
1312121.title: The Seat Sprint

13121212.content:
No sooner had the hopeful thought crossed your mind when a searing pain shot up your leg. The muscles in your leg locked up and with a yell you face planted onto the couch. You heard Pearl grown as she watched your performance on the TV. You took a moment to let out a muffled scream of rage and disbelief, before you got back to your feet and began hobbling the rest of the way. It hurt like hell, but you weren't going to just give up. Not with Pearl watching your performance at any rate.

"Uh-oh! Poor little guy seems to be having trouble," the announcer said, causing titters from the audience.

"Shut up with the color commentary," you growled.

At your dramatically reduced speed, you weren't making good time. You'd barely gotten further than the halfway point and now the clock was down to ten seconds. You tried to double your efforts but it made little difference.

5... 4... 3... 2... 1...

There was a bang signaling the end of the challenge. You stopped and gulped. You knew what was coming next. You had just enough time to look up as Pearl's titanic behind crashed down on top of you. Her dress had ridden up so that you were squashed beneath her bare cheeks. The pain was worse than training. Not only was your body already in immense pain, but the couch you were on wasn't as soft as the one at Pearl's home. You were completely immobile, trapped beneath the pressure of the tons and tons of weight of Pearl's blubber butt. Just when you thought it couldn't get any worse, Pearl subtly began to grind her cheeks on top of you. Even underneath her you could hear her growl, "Do you like that? Is this what you wanted? This. Is. What. You. Get," she said through gritted teeth, punctuating each word with a vicious twist of her butt.

After a minute, the announcer asked for Pearl to stop so the next contestant could go. She got up, revealing that your flattened form was plastered on one of her cheeks. The jumbo screen zoomed in close on you, signaling roars of laughter from the crowd. Pearl didn't understand what they were laughing at, at first. When she turned around to retrieve you to see your miniscule form gone, she realized what happened and blushed in embarrassment. She tried to cover it up by laughing along as she pealed you off her rump. She watched as the sight of you two were replaced by your score on the screen: 25. Maybe the judges admired your effort? Maybe they pitied you? Either way, it was better than a 2. Pearl didn't seem to think so, as she plopped you on the arm rest of the couch with obvious contempt as the next goddess and her champion approached the couch.

You laid on the armrest panting, unbelieving your lousy luck. The only good news for you was that you now had some time, no matter how short, to recover. Other champions did Pearl's challenge, and you took some comfort in seeing that this time, you weren't the only one who failed. Several other contestants vanished beneath her butt, unfortunately though, Romulus didn't. Neither did Lila's champion. You managed to recover quite a bit by the time the challenge was over, at least to the point you felt like you had a fighting chance on the next challenge.

What happens next?
13121212.title: Leg cramp, you're squashed

131212121.content:
Remember when you thought you might be able to make a comeback? Well hindsight's a bitch. Even though you had more time to recover for the next challenges, your lack of training and magical items meant you were doomed from the start. Not to mention the first two challenges were the easy ones. The next few hours were a new level of hell as the games became more and more insidious.

After Pearl's game, the next challenge was to run on a treadmill in front of a cheetah goddess. You ended up under her foot within the first minute and spent the rest of the challenge stuck to her paw like a wad of gum, flattened as she walked. The challenge after that had you run forced to walk a tightrope over the open mouth of a hippo goddess. The bad news was, you got two steps before falling. The good news was you avoided being eaten. The worse news was you landed in the goddess's cleavage and she took it as you intentionally being a pervert. She responded by smashing you between her breasts. The next game had you forced to run across the ring to "home base" while a blind bat goddess tried to detect your movements. You almost made it to the end of this course when the bat goddess came soaring out of the sky and landed on you, ass first.

Several more games came and went. None of them went well for you. Finally you and Pearl were waiting for the final challenge to begin. She wasn't even looking at you, but you could feel her burning hatred coming off her. No matter how well you did in the final challenge, you were dead and you knew it.

"Well ladies," the announcer said, "the Goddess Games are almost at an end. It's been a fun year and we'd like to thank all the goddesses and their champions for attending. Give them a round of applause folks!"

The crowd cheered and clapped. Pearl gave a half-hearted wave with the rest of the goddesses.

"Now, it's time to start our final challenge. As tradition, the final game is brought to us by the winner of the previous Goddess Games. In this case, she also won the past three games. Please welcome the goddess of the sky, Dracana!"

You heard Pearl growl as the dragon goddess stepped forward, basking in the adulation of the crowd. Fantastic. Not only were you going to lose, but you were going to be humiliated by your owner's nemesis too.

What game did Dracana come up with?
131212121.title: Failure Montage

1312121212.content:
"... Did the announcer say, "Bite the Goddess"?" you asked, hoping you'd misheard.

"Fight the Goddess," Pearl growled.

That's what you were afraid of. The ring in the center of the arena opened again, swapping out the stage from the last game for a familiar sight: a boxing ring. You gulped. The fat dragoness went over the ropes and raised her fists, basking in the cheers of the crowd. She placed her human champion at one corner of the ring before walking off to the other.

"The game is exactly what it sounds like," the announcer said cheerfully. "Each champion will go one round in a fight with the goddess of the sky. The fight ends after 10 minutes, or when one of the fighter's is knocked out." There was a roar of laughter from the crowd at that. Even the announcer said "knocked out" jokingly. Clearly no human stood a chance against that behemoth in a fight. Your only consolation was that you weren't going to be the only loser in this challenge. Every goddess and champion looked nervous.

"Each champion will be judged on his performance in the fight. At the sound of the bell, begin!"

DING!

To your utter amazement, Romulus approached his goddess without fear. You knew the rules, she couldn't take it easy on him otherwise she'd be disqualified. You almost admired how he was going to his doom like a champ, but mostly you just wanted to see the brute turned to a pancake. That was when bolts of lightning came from his fists and thunder boomed.

"What the hell?!" you squeaked.

"He's got a magical artifact you idiot," Pearl snapped. "Remember? Each champion is allowed one."

Now that she said it, you did remember it. During all the time Romulus had been fighting, he hadn't needed his artifact once to win. You just assumed he was that cocky, but now you realized he'd been saving it to make the last challenge a spectacle. The camera shot a close-up of his artifact. He was wearing a pair of glowing, metal boxing gloves. Sparks shot out from the tips.

"That can't be... it is! The mythical Maelstrom Gloves! An artifact thought lost to time! Legend has it that with their power, even a human can defeat a god! Where Dracana found them, this announcer has no idea, but now we know why the sky goddess picked this particular challenge! If nothing else we'll get to see if the legends are true about the gloves power! This is proving to be the most memorable Goddess Games in centuries!"

Romulus broke out in a run. He smashed his gloves together causing sparks. Arcs of lightning shot out as he banged them together, growing larger each time. Dracana spun around and lashed her tail down right where Romulus stood. The stone cracked beneath it, but Romulus wasn't there anymore. He'd moved in the blink of an eye and was now behind her. The dragon turned and stomped at him. Gone again. Only this time he was right in front of her foot. He pulled back his fist and punched her big toe. There was a spark on contact.

Dracana yelped, grabbed her foot and hopped backwards. It looked like she'd been bitten by a flea. She stumbled but stopped herself from falling. The crowd went silent. They were more figuratively shocked than Dracana was literally. You realized they'd probably never seen goddess hurt before.

"They should see it more often," you muttered. "Would do them good to experience pain firsthand. Maybe make them empathize a little."

Romulus charged his goddess again. Dracana had recovered and spread her massive wings. The wings started flapping, sending huge gusts of wind. The wind should've ripped Romulus off the ground and sent him flying but he brought his fists down into the stone, breaking it and creating handholds for himself. He gritted his teeth and hung on for dear life. His lower half was flapping like a flag.

Dracana stopped and Romulus fell on his stomach. The dragon didn't hesitate. She opened her mouth and sent a jet of fire right where her champion was. You were astounded. She really wasn't holding back. You were even more astounded when Romulus managed to jump over the flame and towards the goddess.

Your jaw dropped. The jump could've easily taken him over a mountain. He flew towards Dracana's face with one fist forward, lightning shooting out. You were sure he was going to deck her right in the face, but Dracana's snake-like neck cracked like a whip. Her head was no longer where it had been and Romulus couldn't change direction. Dracana's jaws clamped shut down on him.

The crowd was silent. Then they gasped. You'd thought the fight was over but the camera zoomed in on Dracana's mouth. She was trying to keep her jaw clenched and was failing. Gradually her teeth opened and everyone got a view of Romulus inside, prying her teeth apart. His muscles strained as he fought to keep her mouth open. With one hand, Romulus kept her mouth open. With the other, he aimed down her throat, lightning getting ready to strike.

"He's gonna do it," you thought. "He's really going to defeat a god in--"

The back of Dracana's throat glowed orange and a second jet of flame washed over Romulus. The human shot out of her mouth like a cannonball. He soared through the air, trailing smoke, over the ropes, out of the ring, and right down on the ground where he lay still, alive but unconscious.

There was a pause. Then the crowd went wild.

"DRACANA! DRACANA! DRACANA! DRACANA!"

The sky goddess blew kisses to the crowd.

"Unbelievable, ladies!" the announcer was screaming. "Simply unbelievable! Romulus lasted three minutes! Three minutes more than this announcer thought possible. Let's give him a big hand folks for that beautiful display!"

The crowd clapped as human medics came over to tend to Romulus. One of his gloves was missing but he'd regained consciousness long enough to give a thumbs up before falling unconscious again.

"Hey," you whined. "Why didn't I get medics after challenges when I got hurt?"

Pearl ignored you. Maybe that was for the best with how mad she looked. You kept your mouth closed and decided to watch the rest of the fights. They didn't last long. Aside from Romulus, no champion lasted more than a minute against Dracana. No sooner had the bell rung then one would find themselves stuck under her foot, smacked out of the ring with her tail, or unconscious in a smoking crater.

Before you knew it, you were in the ring, the mountain of a dragon in the opposite corner, flashing her pearly-white fangs at you in anticipation. You gulped.

"At least the fight'll be over quick," you said under your breath. The pain in the ring would be brief. You were more afraid of the hell Pearl would rain down upon you when you got home. Maybe you spoke too soon.

The bell rang and Dracana, instead of running over to you or letting out a gout of flame, she just strolled leisurely towards you. You swallowed. She hadn't done that for any other champion. You were shivering like a drowned cat as Dracana knelt down in front of you. Her house-sized head was inches from you.

"So, I finally get the little guppy's champion all to myself," Dracana whispered. "I've been waiting a long time for this. That fat fish of a mistress of yours has no place in this pantheon. She couldn't cut it when we were kids and she can't do it now. She couldn't even find a halfway decent champion for herself. She's a disgrace and so are you."

Well... you couldn't argue there.

"I bet you're wondering why I haven't destroyed you yet? Don't worry, I'll answer. It's because I want to make a deal with you. This doesn't have to be painful for you. You've suffered more than enough today, so how does it sound if I don't hurt you at all? Sound good?"

It sounded very good to you. Not that you trusted her, obviously. "What's the catch?"

"The "catch" is that I want you to tell the audience all about what a loser Pearl is. I want you to renounce her as your goddess and spend the next ten minutes worshipping me instead. You'll grovel and plead and beg to do anything for me. I'll give you orders and you'll do it without hesitation. You'll show everyone here just how a true goddess deserves to be treated."

"And if I refuse?"

"Did Pearl ever tell you that the winner of the goddess games gets one request from a goddess that can't be refused?"

You shook your head. That hadn't been established at all! It was like someone was making up the rules as they went along.

"It's usually just a small thing," Dracana said. "A symbolic favor to show good sportsmanship. I haven't asked for much in the past... But this year I believe when I win I might ask a certain ocean goddess to hand over a certain champion of hers."

You gulped.

"Yes," she whispered with a smile. "I might ask that... if you don't do as I say. Then the next ten minutes will be absolute agony for you. A prelude for the suffering you'll endure in my care for the rest of eternity. You will experience more pain than you can possibly imagine. Whatever you're afraid Pearl can do to you, I promise I can do worse."

This was a nightmare. How did you ever get roped into this?

"Well?" Dracana asked. "What do you say? I'll give you ten seconds to answer, otherwise I'll start the torture."

What do you choose?
1312121212.title: Fight the Goddess

13121212122.content:
You thought furiously, trying to make up your mind. Dracana glared at you impatiently. The seconds were ticking away. It wasn't long now before she took your silence as a refusal. A light bulb went off over your head. Wait a minute... Pearl had never told you this rule. What if Dracana was lying? What if she was just manipulating you to embarrass both you and Pearl in front of all the goddesses? For all you knew, the dragoness could've been full of it. On the other hand, you knew for a fact if you just gave up without a fight Pearl would make you suffer for it. The choice was between guaranteed suffering at Pearl's hands or possible suffering at Dracana's. You decided to role the dice and take your chances on the safer better... comparatively safer at least.

"Time's up," Dracana said. "Will you worship me?"

You took a deep breath. "NOT ON YOUR LIFE YOU STUPID LIZARD!"

Your voice echoed through the stands. How, you weren't sure. Maybe there was some hidden, magic microphone. Either way the crowd gasped in shock. Dracana's eyes narrowed and she let out a hiss. Even the announcer sounded surprised.

"Well... give the little guy one thing, he certainly has spirit! But how will Dracana respond--HOLY CRAP!"

The dragoness moved like lightning. One second and she was on her feet, one foot raised above you casting you in shadow. You whimpered, "Mother--"

BAM! The foot came crashing down, smashing you into the stone and flattening you like a bug. You couldn't move under the crushing weight of it. You'd no sooner registered the unbelievable pain than Dracana lifted her foot off of you. She didn't move it, however, she just kept it hovering over your twitching form. You knew what would happen next and tried to beg.

"Please... don't..."

"Too late for mercy, bug."

BAM! The foot came down a second time, so hard that the stone cracked and formed into a crater the exact size and shape of her foot. Then she raised it again. BAM! Raised. BAM! Raised. BAM! BAM! BAM! With each stomp of her foot the crater grew deeper and deeper. Only the divine magic that made you and all champions invulnerable stopped you from popping like a grape. It didn't stop the pain though. That was excruciating.

Dracana lifted the weight off of her ankle and pressed her toes down on you. She grinned as she ground you into the ground like a cigarette bug. Back and forth you were dragged across the ground. Her foot stank of sweat and was covered in dirt, but they weren't of any concern to you. Not with the amount of pain you were in.

After what seemed like forever, Dracana lifted her foot off you and didn't put it back. You were in too much agony to move. Too much to speak. You wondered if it was still too late to take Dracana up on her offer. Not that you had the strength to voice that offer even if it was possible. Dracana bent down and peeled you off the ground with her claws like a wad of chewed gum.

"Don't pass out on me now, bug. We're just getting started. I've still got eight minutes left to make you suffer. A taste of the eternity of torment that awaits you when I win."

"Eternity of torment?" you thought and shuddered as a sinking feeling spread through your stomach. Did that mean she was telling the truth earlier? That she could take you from Pearl as her prize? It figured. You'd gambled and lost. Just like every other gamble you'd taken in life.

Dracana dropped you in the middle of the ring, letting your broken form fall from her fingers. You screamed as you fell. It was like being thrown off a mountain. You smashed into the ground and groaned. Your vision was blurry but the ground was shaking. Dracana turned around, her back to you, and got down on her knees. You were confused for a second, but when she lifted up the back of her toga to reveal a massive, scaly ass, you knew exactly what you were in store for.

"NO!"

She ignored you, lifted her ass high in the air, then dropped it on top of you. If you thought being under her foot was bad, that was nothing compared to the feeling of the sky goddess's colossal behind landing on top of you. It was like being crushed beneath a planet that needed to go on a diet. Dracana wiggled her behind, driving you further into the ground. A few seconds later she got up, and your pulverized form got up with her, stuck like a pancake to one of her ass cheeks. The camera zoomed in on you and you could hear the goddesses roaring in laughter at the sight of you. Dracana pretended to look for you, turning around to look at the spot where you used to be and then comically shrugging her shoulders when you were nowhere to be found. Then she smacked her forehead as if an obvious idea was coming to her, and she looked over her shoulder to find you on her butt.

Dracana proudly wriggled her butt at the camera, taking a few seconds to show you off and bask in the glory of the crowd, before resuming your torture. She jumped into the air, moved her legs out from under her, and fell ass-first back to the ground. BOOM! The earth shook from the impact. You would've cried but even your tear ducts were in pain at this point. You'd no sooner registered the pain than she got up again and--BOOM! Another jump, another crushing weight, more pain beneath her cheeks. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

For her final jump, Dracana got to her feet, unveiled her wings and flapped high into the air, higher, higher, higher. And then she positioned her ass and let gravity do the rest.

BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOM!

No more. No more. No more. If you could talk, you'd gladly offer to worship Dracana until the end of time if it would spare you another second of this agony. Instead, you were stuck to her ass cheek, tiny body broken beneath her booty. With one last wiggle, Dracana got up and peeled you off her ass.

"Only three minutes left," Dracana said. "So sad our time together is almost up. Luckily, it'll only be over for a few minutes. Then you'll come back to me again and I'll show you this wasn't even a fraction of what I'm capable of. But first, I'm feeling a bit peckish. Winning the Goddess Games sure does work up an appetite. I think I've deserved a small snack." Dracana flashed her razor-sharp fangs.

You were convinced. This dragon wasn't a goddess. She was a devil. And she was going to take you to hell. Dracana raised you above her head and opened her salivating maw.

"Well folks," the announcer said, "it looks like Dracana's getting ready to deliver a KO. It would take a miracle for the little guy to get out of this one."

Your pitiful sobbing only made Dracana laugh. She let go and you plummeted down. Past the teeth, over the gums. The dragon's jaw clamped shut behind you, casting you in warm, wet darkness. Her tongue coiled around your miniscule form as soon as you were inside. You were licked and slurped without mercy.

"Mmm, tashty," Dracana mumbled as she sucked on you, savoring her treat. You, meanwhile, were having much less fun. The dragon's saliva soaked you to the bone, and her breath was so foul it made you retch. It smelled like rotten eggs inside. Probably a result of the sulfur from her fire breath. It was also sweltering inside like an oven. Your only hope was that she wouldn't cook you before she swallowed. You may have spoken too soon. A gurgling sound came from the back of her throat and you were convinced you were about to be roasted alive. Instead of fire, however, what washed over you was another wave of foul-smelling air as she burped into her closed mouth. The rancid air burned, stinging your eyes and nostrils.

"Ooh, pardon me," Dracana said mockingly. "Ope oo don min da shmell. Oo'll be headed der shoon enuff," she slurped. You wish she'd just swallow and get it over with. But she couldn't pass up the opportunity to make you suffer as much as possible. She continued to suck on you, moving you all around her mouth, until...

"Unch time!"

She moved you to the back of her throat and you almost felt relief to know your pain would finally be over. For a little while at least. You couldn't believe this dragon would be your new owner for the rest of eternity. Why'd you have to turn down her offer? Hell, why did she have to be so good at these games in the first place? If only there was a way you could beat her. A human taking down a goddess. If that didn't stop her from winning you didn't know what would. But it was pointless to think about that now. There was no way for it to happen. There was no hope for you at all. No--

A glint of silver caught your eye and you saw it. One of the Maelstrom Gloves. The one Romulus had lost! It was stuck in-between two of Dracana's fangs and she didn't even know it! It was within reach. You still had a chance! Despite the pain wracking your body, you began fighting furiously against the tongue trying to drag you to your doom. You fought harder than you've ever fought for anything in your life to get free.

"Yer schquirmin's nicesh. Keep it uhp, en my tummeh."

You ignored Dracana's taunt and struggled on. The tongue was getting looser. The glove was getting closer. Can you break free and grab it? Can you win? Or will you be consigned to the depths of the dragon's stomach?

1) You get free, grab the glove and use it to defeat Dracana

2) You remain stuck, miss the glove and Dracana swallows you
13121212122.title: Wrath of the Sky Goddess

choices: Romulus interrupts, demanding you hand over the glove!
131212121221.content:
You reach out as far as you can, your arm straining....but the life-saving glove remains just out of your reach. Your fingers even tap against the metal surface, but you can't get a good grip. Dracana's slurred laughter echoes around you as she enjoys your struggles.


"Almosht dum, hoomin! Gumma shwallow inna foo shecomds!"


So this was it. You'd be devoured alive, then suffer endless torment at the claws of this sadistic; childish she-dragon, just because you lost some stupid game. Why was the universe so cruel--


Dracana suddenly slaps her tongue to the side and slams you against her fangs. The impact knocks you senseless--
And brings the Maelstrom Glove into reach. You let out a laugh and grab the artifact just as the tongue recenters and the world begins to tilt back--Dracana was going to swallow you! The glove slips on your hand, and you look down to see the dragon's throat open to accept you. Lightning begins sparking from the glove as you rear your arm back to punch.


What the hell, why not throw out a one-liner?

"Watch what you eat, BITCH!"


======


Dracana held up three clawed fingers, beginning her countdown. The audience cheered, awaiting her finisher of the imcompitent human she'd been playing with. "THREE!" They chanted.


"And it seems this match has come to an end," the announcer quipped. "Hopefully the ending won't be a bitter pill to swallow!"


Dracana lowered one claw. "TWO!"
Pearl fumed, shaking with rage. Having her slave be so humiliatingly bad was embarrassing enough, but now Dracana had to make such a spectacle out of it? Bitch. The whale goddess made a mental note to "visit" that village the dumped him on her for this. It had been too long since she got to eat some humans, anyway.

Dracana lowered another claw...then froze, her smug expression falling. She gagged, then winced, then flinched in pain; her hands covering her mouth. The audience stopped cheering, wondering what the twist was.
Then lightning started coming out of her jaws.

Dracana growled, "What the fuc--"
And then an EXPLOSION of lightning forced her jaws open, ejecting her would-be snack!

Like Romulus, you go flying like a cannonball, screaming all the way until you hit the floor and go tumbling ass-over-teakettle across the ring; small lighting bolts shooting out of your single glove. You'd punched the tongue multiple times, just flailing randomly until you'd been sent flying. Your head hurt and you were sure you'd sprained something in the impact, but you still looked up to see Dracana choking on lightning; twitching and flailing as she was electrocuted from within. You must have done a number on her mouth, the saliva conducting the lighting throughout her body!

Dracana gives one final roar of pain...and an explosion of lightning erupts from her mouth, making everyone's hair stand on end. Then, with an earthshaking impact, she collapses to the floor; her eyes spinning in cartoonish circles.

She weakly taps her hand on the ground--a tap-out.
She'd given up.
YOU WON!

The crowd goes wild. Everyone who was cheering your torment is now roaring "DOWN WITH DRACANA! DOWN WITH DRACANA!". The other goddesses are stunned, some even clapping for you or jeering at Dracana. Turns out she isn't too popular after all. You stagger to your feet and raise your gloved fist into the air, exultant.

"HAIL TO THE KING, BABY!" You whoop. Cliche, but who cares? You just kicked a goddess' ass!

Pearl waddles up and snatches you off the ground, grinning like a loon. She gives you a flurry of smothering kisses and laughs.
"I don't believe it! You actually did it! I...I take back EVERY threat I made, ALL the nasty things I did; EVERYTHING! Oh, you are getting a YEAR off chores for this! In fact, you don't even have to call me 'Mistress' anymore! Just...'Miss Pearl' will do, and...EEEEEEE!" She squees and cuddles you against her cheek, elated.

Maybe she wasn't so bad after all.

Dracana begins to stir, coughing smoke and shaking her head. She sees Pearl cuddling you, and looks at your pilfered weapon.
"Urgh...I wondered where that glove went..didn't see that coming." She gets up, then blinks when she notices everyone ISN'T cheering her name. "Wait...did I just LOSE?!"
