While the sight of two human-killers was enjoyable, you felt more and more uncomfortable as the fight went on. If not for the anthros' sakes then for Pickles. You weren't exactly best friends, but he was the only human that lasted long enough for you to get to know in your current circumstances. At the least you'd hope he'd do something to help you if your roles were reversed.

"Hey, Rita," you said. The rhino's eyes flickered down to you. "Don't you think this has gone on long enough? I know you're mad at Clarice, but Sue's your friend, isn't she? And at the rate they're going they're going to tear apart the Gator Sisters apartment."

Your mistress sighed. "You take all the fun out of revenge, Squirt. Alright, alright, ladies. Break it up."

"Wait," you said as she approached the fighting titans. "Don't bring me with you!" Rita ignored your request and stuffed you into her cleavage again for safekeeping. Not that you felt safe, of course. Nor should you have. No sooner had Rita tried to push the two apart then she was pulled into the fray. With all the chaos it might as well have been a cartoon fight cloud consisting of swinging fists and kicking feet. You were jostled, battered and squeezed between Rita's breasts as the three fought. Seeing the fight not ending with Rita's interference, Lisa and Kelly butted in to help. Clarice hissed and spat as Lisa pulled her away.

It took a minute but at last the fight came to an end. Sue's hair was a disheveled mess. Clarice's silk pajamas were in tatters.

"There now," Lisa slurred, patting Clarice on the back. "Got it all out of your system?"

Clarice snarled at Rita and Sue on the other side of the room. The lioness's paws were clenched. The battle was over, but was the war?

1) No. Clarice had managed to snatch both you and Pickles away during the fighting and now clenched you in her paws. She'll hurt you two somehow to punish Sue and Rita.

2) Yes. Clarice left the fight empty-handed and the game awkwardly continues.
14311111113.title: Overly Protective Cousin

143111111132.content:
The breath was being crushed out of your lungs as you tried to lift one of Rita's massive mammarys off you. The chaos of the fight had sent you deep into the abyss of Rita's sweaty cleavage. You supposed you were just lucky you weren't thrown free in the tussle. You didn't want to think what might've happened to you if you were amidst the rolling bodies. Hell, if Clarice got her paws on you, she'd probably skin you alive just to spite Rita. Apparently Rita had a similar thought, because as soon as she got up and dusted herself off, she hastily checked her "storage" space to make sure you were alright. When she saw you were fine, if slightly flattened, she let out a sigh of relief. Sue might not have been so lucky however, as she was scanning the ground for her human.

"Pickles? Pickles?! Where are you Pickles?!" she called, close to tears. "Don't tell me that mean cat killed you!"

Lisa chuckled drunkenly. "He's on yer assh, Shue."

You looked at the vast expanse of the cow's ass and saw Lisa was right. Pickles was embedded in Sue's crack, slightly flattened but still alive. Even though you pitied the condition of your pseudo-friend, the sight of Sue trying to crane her neck so she could see her plastered pet on her posterior was amusing. She ended up spinning in place, looking like a dog chasing its tail. Mercifully, Kelly took pity on her friend and helped free Pickles from her rump. Peeling him off ended up making a sound like a sticker being yanked off clothes. No sooner had Pickles gotten free and was able to take deep breaths of relief, than Sue grabbed him and began giving him big slobbery kisses out of relief for his safety.

"Poor bastard," you murmured, before remembering you were still wedged in the cleavage of a rhino.

"Soooooooooo," Lisa slured. "Now that that's done wiff. Why don' we go back to dah game?"

"Are you out of your mind?!" Sue yelled, clutching Pickles tightly to her breast. "I'm not playing with her," she said looking at Clarice. "She tried to kill me and nearly killed my poor, Pickles!"

"She broke my cousin's heart and ruined my silk pajamas!" Clarice hissed. "Do you have any idea how much these cost?!"

"I don't care!" Sue huffed. "I'm leaving!"

"So I am!" the lioness snarled.

"Wha?!" Lisa said. "Ya can' go! Dis par-tay wash jes getting schtarted! Kel, talk sum scense into dem."

"Um... I'm not so sure, Lisa," Kelly said, in her shy, soft-spoken voice. She was looking at the ruin of their apartment, probably calculating how much it was going to cost to fix. "Maybe we should call it a night--"

"See? Ya can' leave! Kel sez so," Lisa said, blissfully living in an alternate, inhebriated reality where her sister had agreed wholeheartedly with her. "Jush wai one sec. Ah gotta idea on how to kick dis par-tay up a notsh."

Before anyone could argue, Lisa ran into the kitchen.

"I swear," Clarice muttered. "If her idea to save this sleepover is to have another human binge-eating contest, I'm going to turn her into a suitcase."

"TA-DA!"

Lisa emerged back into the room, holding something over her head. To everyone's surprise, it wasn't a case of tiny humans. Unfortunately, it could be something far more deadly: tequila and shot glasses. You gulped. Anthro Titans were scary enough. Drunken Anthro Titans was a new level of fear entirely. You coughed nervously and tried to get Rita's eye.

"Um, maybe we should get home? Don't want to burn the midnight oil, do we--"

"Ooh, Lisa! You've been holding out on us, girl! I didn't know you had the good stuff!" Rita said, apparently indifferent to your protests.

Lisa chuckled and poured two shot glasses. "On'y ta be used in case of emergenenseas," she said, then offered a class to Sue and Clarice both. "Trushe?"

The lioness and the cow stared at each other for a long time but finally took the glasses. "Truce," they both said, and drank at the same time.

"WOOHOO! LET DA PAR-TAY COMMENSH!"

The next half an hour passed and the game of Truth or Dare continued, only this time whoever was playing had to take a shot before choosing Truth or Dare. The atmosphere became more relaxed amongst the anthros, but more perilous for the human servants that were still alive. As inhibitions loosened, dare was picked more and more often, and now the humans were in serious trouble. So far the dares had been tame enough so that no human had died yet, but you knew it was only a matter of time before things went too far. You kept a particularly close eye on Rita. She was a lightweight when it came to drinking and by her second shot, she was becoming more and more absent-minded and uninhibited. Now, instead of freeing yourself from her bosom, you tried to bury yourself in deeper to hide yourself. Unfortunately, this ended up having the opposite effect.

"Ey! Wazza madda wiff you?" Rita slurred and hiccupped, digging you out of her breasts. "Yer actin' awful frisky t'night. Don'--HIC!--write a check ya can't cash," she said, wiggling her eyebrows. You shuddered in horror.

"I choose Rita," Clarice said.

"Uh?" Rita said.

The lioness smiled. "It's your turn. Truth or dare?" She had had five shots already and didn't show a single sign of drunkenness. Figured she'd be the only one not to be affected by the drink.

"Don'tsaydaredon'tsaydaredon'tsaydare!" you whispered frantically to Rita.

"Whazzat? Dare?" she asked mishearing you. "Yer aw'fly brave, Squirt. I waz gunna say troof, but if ya insist. Dare!"

You smacked your forehead. Of course this would happen. Clarice smiled victoriously and you gulped.

"I dare you... to take another shot... but with your human in the glass!"

"Psycho cat!" you hissed under your breath. She must've been waiting for this moment. The moment where Rita was drunk enough that the lioness could get her revenge for arranging that earlier fight. You'd be impressed at how diabolical she was if you weren't too busy sweating bullets. You looked at Rita and pleaded. "Rita! You wouldn't do that, right? It's me! Your Squirt! Remember all the good times we had? That time you sat on me. That time you forced me to give you a foot massage... That time you... sat on me again... and farted--"

Rita barked out a laugh at the memory. You cringed and tried to keep arguing.

"Um... Well, anyway--I'm the only human you have! Remember how much money it cost to buy me? If I die you can't afford to get another!"

Rita looked at you, smirking. You could smell the alcohol on her breath from here. Hopefully she wasn't so drunk that she'd completely disregard your safety... Was she?

1) She's too drunk to be concerned about you and does the dare without reservation.

2) She's not drunk enough to risk your safety and refuses the dare. What are the consequences of refusal?
143111111132.title: Give the Game Another Shots

choices: Rita sits on you! You're (hopefully) safe!
Clairice grabs you at the last second!
1431111111321.content:
Rita let out a drunken chuckle. "Shoundsh like vun, Clear...Clarr...Cah-lair-eesh! Shkwert hashn't had a shtiff drink im forebber! He shuoud get im on da fun!" She reached into her breasts, awkwardly grasping for you. She missed, once; twice; three times: Rita was so drunk she couldn't see straight! But each try brought her closer to snatching you. You flinched back at each fumble, going deeper into her massive pachydermic mammaries. "C'mon, Shkwert! A daresh'--*hic!*--a dare!"

The fingers grasped at you again, and you fall away...and with a yelp, you find yourself slipping out from between the entrapping boobs.

"He fell outta yer hooters!" You hear Lisa comment.
Bouncing off Rita's rough grey hide you tumble downward, slipping out from under her tank top, and go rolling down her huge body. You roll down her chest, your head smacking against ribs--that to you were as big as speed bumps--making you see stars. Reaching her plump belly, you go bouncing around the flabby surface; Rita giggles at each impact as you tickle her tummy. Finally, you bounce one last time and go flying, flailing through the air before landing with an "OOF!" on the floor: right in front of where Rita is sitting.

Nothing was broken...somehow. You'd just fell from hundreds of feet, and yet you HADN'T popped like a grape. Physics seemed to take the day off when Anthros were involved.

Rita leans over you, followed by Sue and Lisa. "Oh dear, is he alright?" Sue asked, geniunely worried. The cow leans down and examnes you. "He took quite a fall there."

"Nah, the li'l twerp'll be okay," Lisa puts in, chuckling. "If he can survive Rita's big booty squishing him all the time, he can take a little tumble. See? He's moving and everything!"
Your only move had been to flip the drunken giant gator woman off, but she didn't seem to notice that.

Rita hiccuped and giggled. "Hey..sinch he'sh on da floor...maybe I should sit on him again...punish 'im fer not lettin' me grab 'im!" With a great effort she propped herself up and slowly spun around until her massive butt was hovering over you for the second time today. And getting sat on looked a HELL of a lot better than joining Rita's next shot of alcohol in her stomach.

That bone-crushing ass of hers could be your salvation!

The massive cheeks drop, and you open your arms to accept them...
1431111111321.title: The Perils of Alcoholism

14311111113211.content:
Rita's ass came down on you like the meteor that wiped out the dinosaurs. From the corner of your eye, you saw Clarice make a move to grab you. You had just enough time to think, "Evil, bitch," before you were buried beneath an avalanche of rhino glutes. Any satisfaction you could get from being spared a dip in Rita's alcohol-filled stomach was immediately cut off by the ensuing wave of agony. You'd long since given up wondering how you avoided being squashed like a bug every time Rita slammed her ginormous ass on top of you, but just because you survived didn't mean it didn't hurt like hell. Unfortunately, whatever quirk of nature helped you survive also seemed to keep you conscious to endure every second of the torment. You were plastered beneath countless tons of weight, unable to move, barely able to breathe, the pressure grinding you into the floor. Outside you could hear Rita and her friends laughing at your humiliation. All of them found it hilarious. All of them except Clarice.

"Yes, yes, very funny," Clarice said. "But that wasn't the dare, was it? Now, Rita, move your big butt and--"

The lioness cut off as a loud groan came from Rita's stomach. The sound set a tingle down your spine and you whimpered helplessly. You'd heard that noise enough times to know what it meant.

PPPPPPPPPPPFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT!

Rita let loose an earth-shattering fart, point-blank on your microscopic body. All dignity and common sense forgotten, you tried to struggle your way free, even though your tormentor's weight made it literally impossible to move. The best your body could do was shake feebly in protest. You couldn't even close your mouth, forcing the foul stank into your body. Your insides were burning! You'd need to wash and scrub your guts to ever feel normal again! No, forget washing, you'd need an exorcist to get this reeking presence out of you! From the sounds of it, none of Rita's friends appreciated her display any more than you did. None of them except Lisa, who was laughing her ass off even as she was coughing on the smell.

"Bravo! Bravo! Magnifico!" she cheered.

"What are you, five?" Clarice hissed. "That's disgusting! I need a shower to get this smell out of my fur!"

"S...shorry," Rita slurred, but you could hear her chuckling. "I forgot how bad my beer farts are."

So had you when you'd prayed to be crushed beneath her butt rather than sent to her stomach. Though how you could've ever forgotten a smell this bad when you'd been subjected to it before was another of the great mysteries of the universe.

PPPPFFFFFFRRRRRRRTTTTT!

Another burst of gas sent you sobbing for mercy, your eyes stinging with tears. You could hear a chorus of groans agreeing with your assessment outside. "What are you all complaining about?!" you thought. "I'm the one dealing with this at point-blank range you animals!"

"Whaaaaaaaaat?" Rita said, laughing. "Ish *hic* ish natural!"

There was nothing natural about this! Such a smell had to be the work of a gypsy's curse! Screw fear of being eaten! You'd happily take a swan dive down Rita's throat if it meant no longer enduring a single second of this torture.

"That's it," Clarice snapped. "I'm going to bed. Kelly, I'm sleeping in your bed."

"What?" the meek reptile squeaked.

"Yeah," Lisa said. "Ish pretty late. We shud all gedda bed."

You felt Rita prepare to get up and you thanked merciful god in heaven that your nightmare was finally over.

"Oh no," Clarice said. "You're staying right here, Rita. I'm not going to stay up all night choking on your stink."

"I hate to agree," Kelly said, "but I don't want our bedroom to smell."

Curse you merciful god in heaven!

"Fine, fine," Rita said, yawning. Her eyelids were already feeling heavy and she grabbed a pillow from off the couch without moving. She laid down on the floor, without her butt scooching an inch off of you. "I'll schleep here and see you gils in da... in da mornin'."

"NoNoNO! WHAT ABOUT ME?!" You tried to scream the words but they came out as a wheeze. Unfortunately, it seemed your presence was entirely forgotten as the girls all got up and headed to the bedroom. All of them except Rita, who stayed right where she was, her butt planted firmly on your helpless form. You tried to wiggle and scream to get her attention but it was just as useless now as it had been every other time you'd been trapped underneath her. In less than a minute you heard Rita's snores. Almost immediately afterwards there came another groan from her stomach. You sobbed helplessly as you were subjected to yet another whirlwind of funk.

PPPPPFFFFFRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAATTTTTTTTTTTTT!

Rita sighed contentedly in her sleep and you let out a silent scream. And so the hours passed, your mistress sleeping peacefully as she frequently blasted you with flatulence. Sleep never came, you were forced to endure every second of it in conscious agony. Would freedom ever come before the night was over?
14311111113211.title: Rita sits on you! You're (hopefully) safe!

choices: "No way. Not in front of Squirt."
"Guess I'll try it. Can't hurt, right?"
143111111132111.content:
You thrashed.
You squirmed.
You struggled.
You even resorted to BITING Rita's crushing, all-emcompassing rump...but it was hopeless. Your rhino mistress was out like a light, blissfully ignorant of your attempts to free yourself as she blissfully snored away. She didn't even giggle from the tickling you must have been giving her butt, like she normally did when she sat on you.

Rita was, to use the technical term, "Knocked Dafuq Out".

"GET OFF, YOU STUPID PACHYDERM BITCH! GET YOUR FAT BONE-CRUSHING ASS OFF ME!" You try to scream it, but even to your own ears your voice is muffled by the mountain of rhino crushing down on you. Talking also gets you an open mouth full of rhino-rump, choking out any furhter rants.

"Whazzat? Whoshtalkin'...?" Rita's voice slurs. You try to pinch her cheek to get her attention, but her yoga pants and thick hide block it. Not to mention Rita being drunk off her ass. "Waaateva...gon' sleep..." She burps and slumps back to sleep, wiggling her cheeks down on you.

You scream in pain, wondering what god you angered to deserve this. Why can't you just die already?!

Another small pfft renews the stench, and the night drags on. Rita grinds on you on and off over the hours, and you keep squirming and struggling.

Mercifully, Rita stopped farting after the first few hours.

=====Next Morning====

You spend a few minutes wondering if you're dead. The first sign you HAVEN'T suffocated to death was that you could still feel pain. Rita's ominipresent ass still enveloped you, but you were still alive enough to feel the hundreds of tons crushing down on your tiny form. You could still struggle, so no bones had been broken: another sign of life.

As much as you hated it, you weren't dead yet.

Stomping footsteps shake the floor, before a familiar voice calls out, "Good morning, ladies! How was the PAR-TAY?! You up for the day?!" Even muffled by the mountain of rhino ass flattening you, it's obvious it was Lisa--sounding slightly less drunk than last night.

"Shut. UP, Lisa." Rita moans. "Ugh...why won't the light shut up?!" The weight that had been crushing down on you shoots up as Rita sits up, her ass pressing down on you as she wiggles down drunkenly. "Huh, the stink is gone."

Not for me, you disgusting slob!

"Sprayed some air freshener durin' the night. Cleaned your fart-fest right outta the air!" Lisa answers. "By the way, Squirt's been under your ass all night."

"WHAT?!" Rita yelps. She sounds genuinely concerned--she'd never sat on you for that long before.

"And you've probably been farting on him all night, too." You couldn't see the fat gator, but you heard the smile on her voice. "Hope he didn't suffocate down there!"

Rita yelps again and lifts her cheek...and you with it. You'd been plastered to her ass like a sticker. "Oh no--please be okay, Squirt! Please be okay...!" Slowly, gently, Rita peels off her all-encompassing cheek and cradles you in her hands. "C'mon, say something! Insult me; call my ass fat; let me know you're okay!"

The light hurt your eyes after so long in the dark; your entire body ached like hell from being flattened; you could barely think straight after so much pain...but you still heard the concern in Rita's voice.

She was genuinely worried she'd hurt you. Maybe the rhino-woman wasn't COMPLETELY horrible.

You manage to croak out, "You EVER do that again...I'll give you colon cancer." You meant it.

Rita's eyes sparkle at your threat. "EEEEE! HE'S OKAY!" Her face lunges at you--" *whap!*--and she cuddles you against her cheek, cooing giddily. "That was too close...thank frick you're okay, Squirt. I couldn't lose a little escape artist like you! Oh, I'm not sitting on you for a YEAR after that! Maybe longer--you won't have to fear my booty for a LONG time! I'm so sorry!"

You smile despite yourself. Rita genuinely meant that! Maybe things would get better for you. At least you wouldn't have to worry about her sitting on you for a while...
Suddenly, Rita sniffs you...and cringes away gagging. "Ugh, you need a shower. Hey Lisa, can I borrow your sink for a minute?"

One scrub-down in the sink later, you'd gotten the stink of rhino-fart off you and were wedged between Rita's ample breasts. All the girls save Lisa were at the dining table, nursing their hangovers. Even Clarice looked under the weather.

"Is that what a hairball feels like?" the lioness growls, rubbing her temples. "I knew I overdid the shots in Truth-or-Dare..."

Bitch got what she deserved. Rita could have easily eaten you in a drunken stupor last night...

The door to the kitched slammed open, making everyone jump. Lisa came strolling in, wearing nothing but a pink bathrobe and carrying a plastic container. "Mornin', ladies! I brought you all something to clear your heads after our WILD night!"

"What's that, sis?" Kelly asked, sounding even meeker than usual. The younger gator looked horrible--she obviously didn't have the same alcohol tolerance as her sister.

"My paton--pattycakes---pat-en-ted hangover cure: humans! Eat a few and you'll be yourselves again in no time!" Lisa explained, talking over the wails and pleading coming from the plastic box. "Trust me, works every time. Already chomped a few before you all got up, and I'm already slurrin' less." You go pale and instinctively hide deeper in Rita's cleavage. You knew anthros ate humans, and Lisa's appetite went without saying, but seeing her be so casual about it was horrifying.

Clarice meows in pain, rubbing her temple. "Not so loud...and I don't buy it--that reptile liver of yours is like a jet engine, Lisa. You pounded away more booze than any of us; you shouldn't even be walking."

"That..doesn't make sense," Kelly mumbled, trying to right her glasses. "How would eating humans purge the alcohol from our systems?"

Rita snorts. "Is this some weird trick to get us to owe you money? Didn't we set a rule any humans we eat or squish we have to pay for?" She yelps, covering her eyes. "Ugh, turn off the sun; it's too bright."

"Naw, I wouldn't do that to ya.These are free--from a friend, ta get the alcohol outta your systems. And hey, even if it doesn't work, ya get some humans fer breakfast! I know that's a treat fer some of ya!"

Clairice didn't bother asking. She simply snatched two humans from the box and tossed them in her mouth, swishing a bit before swallowing them whole. She let out a satisfied murr, tracing their path down her throat. "Ahhh...you always pick the most delicious humans, Lisa."

"I...don't think I can do this in front of Pickles," Sue mumbled.

"I could take him back to my room, leave him with Pee-Wee for a bit. Would do them good too chat with another human," Kelly offered helpfully. "Besides, you do need to eat some humans sometime Sue; even herbivore anthros eat them to stay healthy."

"I guess..." the cow mumbles, handing her human over. As Kelly leaves, the heifer gently grabs a human from the box and holds her before her face. "Sorry, missy. I'll make it quick, okay?"

"PLEASE, NO! DON'T EAT ME! I'LL DO ANYTH--" the woman's pleading was cut off by Sue gingerly placing her on her bovine tongue and slurping her into her maw. She mooed in delight at the human's flavor before tilting her head back and swallowing. Looking guilty, she patted her plump belly. "Sorry, little human..."

Lisa was too busy grabbing handfuls of humans to say anything.

Kelly came back, eyeing the few humans left in Lisa's box. "Lisa, you hogged so many of them...Rita, are you going to eat any? Looks like the other girls are already getting over their hangovers."

You looked at the other anthros. It was...true. The women did seem to be coming around after eating a few humans. Rita's quiet "huh" showed she noticed it, too.

Rita hesitated for a long moment, before giving her answer...
143111111132111.title: Hangovers and Hangups

choices: Promises are made to be broken
1431111111321111.content:
"No way. Not in front of Squirt." It looked like your puppy dog eyes had the desired effect... to an extent. "I wouldn't want to traumatize him by forcing him to watch me munch on some of his own kind."

"It's still traumatizing, even if you do it out of sight!" you objected.

"Oh, hush," she said. "You heard Kelly. Humans keep a girl's digestive system healthy."

"You humor that insect far too much, Rita," Clarice said. "I'd never let a human talk back to me that way. He's just a slave. You give one an inch and they'll walk all over you. It's why my slaves are the most obedient around."

Rita ignored her and turned to her friend. "Kelly, you mind putting him with Pee-Wee and Pickles while we finish breakfast?"

"I'LL TAKE HIM!" Lisa volunteered, already barging forward to snatch you. You yelped at the eagerness in her voice and hunger in her eyes. You fell flat on your ass as Rita pulled you backwards, even scooching back her chair to put more distance between her slave and her friend. Luckily for you, Rita had the same reservations that you did about leaving you and Lisa alone together.

"Um, that's alright, Lisa. Kelly can take him."

The large alligator looked crestfallen.

"Tsk-tsk-tsk," Clarice said, smiling cruelly. "Now is that any way to treat a friend, Rita? Here Lisa is, nice enough to let you spend the night at her place, taking you to the beach yesterday on her dime, and even offering you a delicacy you rarely get to have, and you can't even trust her with your human? She's your friend. Do you really think she has so little self-control?"

"Yeah, Rita," Lisa said, looking hurt, "don't you trust me?"

"Of course she doesn't trust you!" you cried out. "You have zero self-control! If there are five humans alone in a room with you, you'll eat seventeen of them! Rita, you can't leave me alone with her--"

"Quiet, Squirt," Rita snapped.

You realized your outburst had only made things worse. Lisa looked even sadder, Rita seemed ashamed, and the rest of her friends looked uncomfortable, all except for Clarice, who smiled smugly. You'd played right into her paws. You hated that cat so much. She was pure evil.

Unfortunately for you, Lisa's puppy dog eyes were just as effective on Rita as yours had been. The rhino sighed. "Of course I trust you, Lisa," she said in a strained voice. "Please put Squirt with the others. I know you won't eat h--"

"THANKS RITA!" Lisa said, not bothering to listen to the end of her sentence. You barely got out a plea before the obese alligator had snatched you out of your owner's hands. "Come on, Squirt!"

"RITA! RITA HELP ME!"

Your owner only looked sadly at you, torn between wanting to protect you and not wanting to embarrass her friend. She stayed seated and gave you an apologetic shrug as Lisa happily skipped out of the kitchen and into the hall. You prayed Lisa was telling the truth and she'd just put you with the other slaves like she said she would. But just when she was about to go inside Kelly's bedroom, she paused outside the door and uncapped her hand. Her massive face filled your view of vision. You gulped and gave an awkward wave. "Um... hi? YIPE!"

You were yanked off your feet by a vortex of air as Lisa lowered her snout and sniffed deeply. The only thing that stopped you from flying up and disappearing into one of her nostrils was a lucky grab that let you latch on to one of her fingers. Lisa didn't even notice your plight as she closed her eyes and let out a dreamy sigh at your scent.

"What is it about your scent, Squirt?" Lisa asked. She licked her black-painted lips and you noticed the excess of drool in her mouth. A mouth, you noticed, that was inching closer and closer to you.

"Lisa? LISA!" you yelled, hoping to get through to her. "You promised Rita you wouldn't eat me! Remember, she's your friend! She trusts you!"

Lisa hesitated, as if breaking out of a trance. "Right," she murmured. "I promised... But you're just... so..." She licked her lips, her eyelids lowered and her mouth came closer again, "So... irresistible!"

"LISA, STOP!"

Does she?

1) Yes. Lisa keeps her promise and leaves you with your fellow human slaves. You're safe. For now.

2) No. Lisa breaks her promise. She can't resist the opportunity to finally eat you.
1431111111321111.title: "No way. Not in front of Squirt."

1431111111321112.content:
"Guess I'll try it. Can't hurt, right?"

The words echoed in your mind after Rita had said them. So much for thinking Rita wasn't all bad. Not a half hour after promising to spare you the future indignity of being plastered under her ass, here she was, willing to scarf down humans right in front of you. Unlike Lisa, you knew humans weren't a mainstay of Rita's diet. However, the only reason for that was because she was too poor to afford humans regularly as food. Whenever there was a special occasion, or her friends were treating, Rita would happily indulge in some human cuisine. Sure she'd threatened to eat you in the past during your many escape attempts, but she'd never actually tried it on purpose. The closest she got was accidentally knocking you into her ramen noodles once. She'd been listening to music and hadn't heard your screams over the blare of her headphones. It'd taken all your strength to pull yourself free of the bowl before you found yourself joining the noodles in her stomach. The thing that had horrified you most of all though was Rita's obvious satisfaction as she ate, savoring the unique taste of the ramen as she devoured it. Once you were out, however, she was disappointed, saying that it'd lost its flavor. After that close call, you'd wisely decided never to mention the experience to her, worried what she'd do if she found out you were the source of that delicious taste.

Rita was too hungover to even give you an apologetic look as she reached into Lisa's human bin and rummaged around. You watched in horror as her thick gray fingers chased whatever human was in reach, finally landing on a young man around your age who tripped and found himself plucked from his enclosure. Rita raised him in front of her mouth and ran her tongue over her lips. You felt sick as you realized how much she was looking forward to this. She seemed oblivious to her tiny victim's pleas for mercy, or your disgusted look. She stuck out her tongue and plopped the little man on it. He had just enough time to let out one last audible scream for help before she slurped him into her drooling maw.

"MmmmMMMHHHHMMMM!" Rita squealed pleasantly. She didn't swallow him right away. She took the time to close her eyes and savor the tiny man's taste, sucking on him like a piece of candy. She only became self-conscious of her behavior after a small dribble of drool escaped the corner of her mouth. She opened her eyes to make sure no one had seen when she realized all eyes were on her. Kelly and Sue looked shocked. Lisa was fighting to hold back her laughter, while Clarice was looking at her with clear contempt and mockery.

"No, please," the lioness said. "Continue making love to that human in your mouth. It's not at all disgusting and inappropriate to do in public."

Rita blushed as she wiped the drool off her chin and--her enjoyment prematurely ended--gulped her human snack down guiltily. It was only now she seemed to remember you'd been watching her the entire time.

"What?" she asked. You stared at her in open disgust. "What?" she repeated defensively.

"You're a monster," you said.

"Don't look at me like that!" Rita said. "Anthros have been eating humans for as long as the two races have coexisted. It's the law of nature!"

"There was nothing natural about what you were doing," Clarice said. "I know humans are a delicacy you can scarcely afford, Rita, but that's no reason to act like an animal when you finally get the chance to indulge."

"Shut up, Hairball!"

"Hey now, it's alright, Rita," Lisa said sympathetically. "I know when I find a human who's tastier than I expected, I make sure to get every ounce of flavor out of them before gulping them down. Some humans just have a certain taste that drives me wild. Even the scent of them makes me slobber." As she said this, you noticed her eyes were pointedly fixed on your miniscule body. This morning was just a terrible reminder--no matter how kindly Rita treated you--you were still in the most vulnerable position on the food chain. Rita noticed where her friend's gaze was locked on too and gave a pointed cough to catch her attention.

"Uh, so anyway," Lisa said, "what do you gals want to do today?"

"We could go swimming again," Rita said. "I always enjoy a day at the beach."

"Ooh! Ooh!" Sue said, perking up. "I saw them setting up a carnival yesterday! Why don't we go? There will be games and rides--"

"And fried food," Lisa said, drooling. "I'm in!"

"Much as I dislike agreeing with Rita," Clarice said, "I'd much rather work on my tan than surround myself with carnies." Nobody voiced the obvious question of how someone covered in fur could even work on their tan.

"So it's two against two," Lisa said. "Sis, you're the tie-breaker. Where do you want to go?"

Kelly thought for a second before answering. Which did she pick?
1431111111321112.title: It could hurt a lot actually

choices: You get taken by the current, and Rita swallows you!
You manage to hold onto her tongue...somehow.
14311111113212.content:
At the last second before Rita's rump makes impact, something large and furry envelopes your form, and you feel yourself being yanked away. Half a second later, you hear the thunderous impact of Rita sitting down.

"Hey! I don' feel 'im wiggling under there..." Rita's voice mumbles.

"Because I took him," you hear Clairice pur. Swearing to yourself, you feel her paw open and look into her smirking face. "It's unsanitary to eat--I mean, flavor your drink with something you just SAT on, after all. And that WAS the dare, right Rita?"

Sue blinks, sharing a worried look with Kelly. "Eat..?" they chorus. It looked like they were finally catching onto what Clairice was doing...but they were too drunk, or to scared of her bullying, to try and stop her.

Rita looks up and blinks, her memory coming back. "Oh, right! The dare!" She slaps her forehead. "Shilly me. Almosht forgot--oh well, I'll sit on Shkwert later...maybe not wearin' ANYTHING! Never tried it naked before..."

"And I'm sure it'll be fun for you both," Clairice answers patronizingly. "But now for the dare..."

Before you can protest, you're rudely dropped into a shot glass. A flood of cheap liquor assaults you, burning your eyes and knocking you off your feet as Lisa pours it in. It smells like rubbing alcohol and gasoline...apparently the gator was a cheapskate when it came to buying booze.

Rita's face looms over you once more...only now you can only see her gaping mouth, big enough to swallow a crowd of humans in a single gulp. You're too terrified to scream.

"Hold on tight, Shkwert!" Rita taunts drunkenly...and knocks back the glass.
You had no chance of holding on. The glass was to smooth, and you'd swallowed some of the liquor, leaving you hit with a wave of drunkenness for a moment. Gravity and current take you into darkness--into Rita's mouth.

Outside, you hear drunken cheers and applause..the dare must have been a hit with the girls. Rita even gargles a laugh around you. Then gravity shifts again..she was tilting her head back to swallow!

Desperate, you try and grab her landscape-sized tongue, to avoid being sent to your fate in her plump belly....
14311111113212.title: Clairice grabs you at the last second!

15.content:
Far and away in the heart of the Evian Empire, was a monolithic structure made of marble. It had great towers and halls and gardens of the most exotic sort of flowers. The city was encamped in a forest of great towering pines, flanked from both sides by the great mountains of Draconder. A glistening all encompassing sea on it’s west and mountains that rumored to imprison the titans to the east. This pure ivory monument surrounded by nature’s bounty was Wilksbourogh. The Capital City of the dragons of the Evian Empire.

It was an eccentric society of draconians. Not for the taking of hominids, particularly humans, as thralls. But rather the large and gluttonous dragons that resided there. There were slender drakes and dragonesses sure, but the majority of them and the whole of the royal family were comprised of hyper fat, hyper voluptuous, macro like dragons, so large they should be immobile, but always manage to carry their weight with not only finesses, but lack of effort, as if they were completely unhindered by their own massive bodies.

These dragons were lead by Queen Karthio, a dragonness both of great stature and great girth. The mighty Queen's ruby red scales glimmered in the light due to constant buffing and polishing by her many servants, her head endowed with silver horns that were almost reflective, a natural crown for the Queen. There was plenty to be polished, as her tremendous gut heavily rested against the floor, flanks expanding beyond the reach of her silver claws, even while standing.

At this particular evening she was lounging in the Queen's gazebo. An elaborate shelter in the upper garden, made of marble and dressed with grand tapestries.
Beside her lounged two of her daughters and the Captain of the Guard. At her left was Roal,the youngest of her expansive royal family. The dumpling shaped dragon was hands down nothing more than a royal brat. She was also the smallest of the three, only being able to reach his Mother's shoulders at the very top of her horns. This, combined with her pastel blue scales and pink belly and wings, made Roal the least respected by the rest of his family. This lack of respect angered the young dragon, and was the reason for her current physique.

And then there was Marian the Girthy to her west. Many would mistake her with her green scales as a rolling green hillside if she lounged about in the middle of a field, easily the largest dragon in the kingdom; her torso was wider than the Queen's wingspan! The Queen’s massive daughter constantly sloshed and shook with the smallest of movements. It’s been years since her log like tail has ever left the ground without any assistance. The soft wings that were folded against her bulging arching back were no more than another limb to store fat. Not that Marian cared at all, her body was a clear sign that the only thing on her mind was food.

They entertained themselves by eating and jibbering to one another at length about things that were only important to those who were wealthy and powerful enough to make such frivolous shallow topics such a priority. These topics were mostly constructed from rumors, gloating, and over inflated stories of grandeur that resulted in jowls jiggling in laughter. The Queen’s guests drank from ancient goblets of gold filled to the brim with the finest wine and ate thick chunks of marbled ham from platters of pure silver; their thralls made great efforts to make sure their patrons never got a chance to see the bottom of either.

Eventually though, there came a pause in the conversation where in the Queen tapped her shiny claws against the cool floor to get everyone's attention. Except Marian, who continuously stuffed her swollen face with food, moaning out “Mmoooaarrrhh.”

"Friends, Family, I have an important announcement." The Queen said as she scratched her plump cheeks. "As you all know, my darling daughters, the pride and joys of my life, are having there birthdays in the following month."

The Queen Karthio paused to allow the guests to clap for her daughters, which was customary. Roal greatly inhaled the applause, while Marian simply blushed and smiled thinly before going back to eating.

"As such," The Queen continued. "Because I am just so terrible at waiting to give presents, I have arranged for my daughters Roal and Marian to both receive their first human!"

The guests applauded again, louder this time. A dragon getting their first human slave was one of the important marks of growing up in this dragon high society. Roal's jaw was gape, while Marian actually stopped eating to listen.

"Oh Mother!" Roal squealed with delight. :This has got to be the--"

"However." Queen Karthio silenced her daughter. "There are some conditions."

"What kind of conditions?" The whole table of guests looked over to see Marian talk more then just the word "More" which was actually very rare.

"I'm glad you asked, Marian. Although this is your present, this is also a test. A test in parenting."

"Parenting?" The two daughters asked at the same time.

"Yes. You see, when I depart from this Earth, I want to make sure that my legacy will live on in you, my children, and your legacy to live on in your children. Yet the two of you have showed no maternal instincts towards anyone, which concerns me. So, although I am granting you a human slave, the slave you will get will be a child."

Whispered snickers bubbled out from the guests in response to this ludicrous game the Queen was playing on her children. "What!?" Roal roared, her jowls jiggling in fury. "But mom--!"

"No 'buts' young lady!" Karthio snapped. "Before you can ever get married, have a life with another dragon, and raise kids of your own, you must test yourself weather or not your ready for it yet. The two of you will each receive a child human. They will care for you, and you will care for them. Feed them, nurture them, help them. For the next month the two of you are temporary mothers. If i see that you raised the human well, you may have a fully grown slave. If not, you will wait untill you are older. Do I make myself clear?"

"Yes mom." Roal and Marian said at the same time.
15.title: Pick yet ANOTHER  Anthro mistress...

choices: They don’t fall for it. They take him!
They really are that stupid. They move on to find an actual kid.
151.content:
“Come on you, how many times do I have to tell you idiots?” I snarled through the bars of my cage. “I’m not a damn kid! I’m twenty-five damn years old!!!”

Likely just a few thousand more short of making the stout, bored-looking drake at the counter to care any more beyond the twelve an hour he was making just sitting there, making sure nobody split with any free ‘profits.’ Then again, if the draconian bureaucracy couldn’t recognize a young adult from a kindergartener upon hearing you try and argue by spewing words such as ‘obfuscate,’ ‘scintillating’ or ‘sycophant,’ than any hope by now was just toxic.

...and yet the dragons were still smart enough to only supply you with a drinking fountain, bed and feeding pen, bare-bone essentials that you wouldn’t risk kicking over in fury; the one thing you wanted more than anything in the world right now. Sure, being a pet was a cloud short of silver linings, but at least you knew had to read; even at an early age, you had the means to know the dragons’ government enough to parry your way by the time you were of legal age. Any other adult would’ve likely been subjected to living a reptilian’s foot so often that they’d accept it in life and move on, but you? You had resources. Intel to at least have a chance to reason your way into some semblance of a normal life, or as much as a life living at the heels of fire-breathing titans could be.

All of which you wouldn’t even be able to use till you were thirty, likely by some moron getting their gum stuck in a filing machines, and even bigger ones who knew your age only from a typing error.

With your head cradled in your knees, the clerk grunting in satisfaction as your pesky ranting was finished your only hope...no, don’t say that anymore. Wacky miracle was to be bought on the cheap, that the next potential buyer would see you for your strong build and smarts for what they were, and realize they could have a decent enough pet at the fraction of a price for half the actual cost. Every tinkle of the bell you’d hear from the door, you’d seize up, tense at the thought of whether the next customer’s footfalls would be the lumbering of a massive adult’s or the pitter-patter of some lazy parent’s snot-nosed kids searching for a new playmate to dress-up, or force you to live in a dollhouse, probably even flush you down the toilet for fun...

[i]Ting-a-ling![/i]

Poor timing to picture that last thought, the air calcifying in your lungs, but it escapes in relief as the entire human store rattles at who, so immense that it’s almost a [i}what[/i], enters. A few humans go silent, hiding in their cages to keep from being seen, but a select few clamor for attention, some desperate to see the world outside their cages, or legitimately excited to have a host to attend to them.

“I still can’t believe mother doesn’t trust us for the adults we are.” One of them argues. “I’ve had classmates back in school with adult humans, and she forces us to get a child!”

Hearing their banter, you’re up and amongst the latter.

“HEY, I’M LEGALLY A CHILD!!!” You holler, throwing an arm out and waving frantically towards the massive overabundance of green that rolls into store and, with the gods finally settling in their laughter and giving you some slack for once, enters the children’s section. “I’M AN ADULT FOR CHEAP!!! I...”

Then the sound of a claw full of cheese-puffs rips through the child’s section, and any of the minority begging for attention is halved again. Coming down the aisle, coming down to you, is the all-known gluttony and enormity of the royal daughter herself, Marian, likely accompanied by her pompous fatty of a sister by the sound of the other voice, as the prior’s mouth is too occupied glutting her impossibly fat frame to even more monstrous proportions. The aisle, as sparsely placed as it is to accommodate the decadent populace of its customers, is compromised by the great plateau that is Marian’s behind as her bulging flanks are snugly wedged by the deceptively wide passage, her stomach bouncing atop her legs in a pronounced cascade of scale-armored rolls and blubber, rubbing against the floor with no cover to protect it from the dirty linoleum.

The mere presence of the quasi-mountain of a dragon girl extinguishes every voice screaming to be taken, and as Marian’s vaguely lucid eyes narrow in on the partitions near where yours is, you hastily take off your shoes and kneel down into their soles, putting on a mediocre impression of a child, or at best, a dwarfish man. Marian’s quaking movements continue, the cage rattling louder as you sit in sweaty hope that the moving landmass of green just passes you without a second thought, but when her scales swipe their way into your visibility, it’s the tip of her snout, her eyes observing you with mere bristles of intelligence that sparks occasionally, a burning lightbulb that only twitches on and off with dying light, but with scrutiny that’s drilling through the bones of your skull, studying your person by outward impressions.

“Hey...” She speaks. Even her voice sounds sluggish, to heavy for her to get out. “This kid here looks like a grown up!”

“NOOOOOOOO!!!” You squeal in your best child voice, but with such little practice, you just screech in a high register. “ME A CHILD!ME MAKE POOPIES IN MY PANTS, MOMMY!!!”

“A grown up?” Roal climbs onto her sister’s shoulder to see for herself, pushing her sister’s head aside. “Hey, you’re right!”

“NOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!” You wail even louder. “ME A WITTLE BABY!!! ME NOT A VICTIM OF BEAUWACWACY, ME A WITTLE BITTY BABY!!! WAAAAAAAAAAHHH!!!”
151.title: Continue this storyline

1511.content:
The great mountain of emerald toned, blubbery flesh looked down past her heaving bosom and bloated stomach at your meager display of action two decades younger. At first, her expression, along with her sister Roal's, unreadable, and you made the mistake of allowing the smallest glimmers of hope reach into your soul. Perhaps, as bad as it was, confirmed by the rather offended glances you were getting from the other human children in the store, they bought the act. Then the smaller of the royal daughters fell off from her perch on her sister's shoulder flab onto the floor, making the whole section shake and quake, laughing uncontrollably on the linoleum and a few tears welling from her eyes. Even Marian smiled and laughed, slow and low like a baritone orchestra.

"Hey, I think I like this one." The mass of scaled lard began to bend down for her puffy appendages to grasp onto your cage, the tiny bit of unfulfilled hope mercilessly evacuating your spirit. You were lifted up into the air high enough for your body to be level with Marian's eyes. She dumped the last bits of cheese flavored corn meal into her drooling maw so that she could focus attention on solely you, something so rare from a creature who almost always had nothing on her mind but her next meal. "He makes me laugh." With that said, she then began the effort to readjust her blobular body around so that she may exit the children's section with you in tow to the cash register, something difficult due to how tight she was packed into the aisle.

You then found yourself in a desperate mess, bones shaking and teeth chattering in fear. This was it. This was really happening. Still, you were not ready to give up just yet. With the intelligence you had been granted, you moved on from deception towards sycophancy. You turn yourself to Roal, still laughing hard but slowly getting up from the floor to avoid being smothered by her sister's bubber. You fall to your knees so quickly they scrape themselves on the floor of your cage, stammering out an apology as you bowed your head. “P-please forgive me, my princess, I was just-” That was all you could get out before your soon to be co-master spoke up.

"Oh God, no, don't you dare apologize! That was the best laugh I had in a long, LONG time. It's a damn good thing that we found you, too, else we would have been stuck with some munchkin." She glanced over to some of the pint-sized tykes on each side of her, almost all of them silent. "They're cute...but I think I would do well with them. Better to have an adult, much more sturdy from what my mom always boasts about." You were about to change your tactics again, still stubbornly clinging to the idea that you could get out of this mess before you the ear-piercing sound of metal warping erupted from behind you. You turned to address the cacophony to see Marian's pudgy hand clench the gate of your cage like paper.

The crumpled up bit of stainless steel was ripped from the frame of the cage and thrown aside to some far off section of the store, reaching its destination amongst the tops of other cages in the teenager's section. Marian then shoved the rest of her arm into your sanctuary, her blubbery digits wrapping around your fear stricken body as she violently kidnapped you from your 'home'. Once you departed the metal box, it too was discarded like trash, and you found yourself sitting on her open palm just below her snout. "What's your name?" She addressed you, opening up a package of snack cookies that seemed to materialize from thin air with her free hand. "You humans do have names, right? I don't have to give you one?"

You swallowed a wad of saliva that was building up at the back of your mouth nervously before answering her. "U-Uh...HQ-82, ma'am..." Marian continued to stare down at you expectantly, to which you then realized that she meant your given name, not your slave identification. You almost forgot that you even had one. "It's D-D-Donat, m-my princess..."

"It's nice to meet you, Doughnut." She smiled before inhaling her carton of cookies past her teeth and into her awaiting throat. She had the common decency to try and stifle the wet belch that cake soon after, but you were still knocked back by the sickly sweet wind. “Here, let me put you someplace more comfy.” Her fat fingers soon wrapped themselves around your diminutive form yet again, and when you were released you found yourself deposited...
1511.title: You Fail At Theatre Forever

152.content:
"Get the speakers loaded on the bus, Roadie!"

You gritted your teeth at the screeching voice, but turned it into a kind of submissive grin as you nodded.

"Right away, Blood Queen," you responded to the plump vampire-bat anthro. She was short for an anthro, only 7-feet-tall. She had red eyes and her fur was completely white, except for her dyed-orange hair, the color of which, combined with its spiky style that stood straight in the air (thanks to several industrial-size cans of hairspray) made it look like her head was on fire. She wore a black, leather jacket with holes cut in the back for her massive wings to stick out, and long fangs.

Blood Queen, or BQ to her friends, or if you were going by her real-name--which, after a few choice death threats, you never did--Bonnie, was your mistress. Well, more accurately she was one of your mistresses. She and her mates in her amateur death metal band, the Killer Sirens, had pooled their funds together to buy a human slave to act as their roadie, and, unfortunately for you, you were the only one they chose. Blood Queen was the leader singer of the band, though with her high, screechy voice, you were sure you'd go deaf from her singing one day, not that you'd ever tell her that. As a mistress, she was a total tyrant, thinking your status as a slave meant you shouldn't have a moment of free time, and she would fill that time whether that meant you waiting on her on hand-and-foot or degrading yourself for her amusement. Giving her particularly rank feet a massage stood out in your mind. No task was too hard or too humiliating for you to perform in her mind. Refusal was met with harsh punishment.

As you struggled to load everything into the bus from their old house, one of your other mistresses looked up from the poetry book she was reading on the porch. Her name was Melancholy (real name: Melody), a full-figured, 10-foot-tall black cat anthro with sapphire-colored eyes. She wasn't exactly thin, but she wasn't exactly what you'd consider fat either. Voluptuous would probably be the appropriate term. She wore a purple, gothic dress and had long white hair. She was the organ player and provided back-up vocals. In fact, her voice was so much better than BQ's, you wondered why she wasn't the lead singer. But then again, death metal had never been your genre, especially not the quasi-goth/punk kind they did... That probably wasn't the actual name of the genre, you weren't up on the lingo, again, it had never been your preference and it's not like they'd give you time to look it up with your new mistresses working you ragged.

Melancholy seemed to be the nicest of your new mistresses, or, at least, the only one who didn't see the point in working you to death or treating you like garbage after paying good money for you.

"Why don't you help him, BQ?" Melancholy asked her band mate in her soothing voice. "He looks like he's going to die carrying all that wait."

You were grateful for the attempt at help, but BQ laughed her off.

"Doing the work yourself defeats the purpose of having a roadie, Mel! I'm not gonna waste my time with that, not when we're finally gonna make the big time playing gigs in the Dark Lands!"

You gulped at the name. The Dark Lands were said to be home to the creepiest, most depraved and evil anthros imaginable. While there were at least a couple laws that provided certain rights and protection to human slaves locally, in the Dark Lands there were no rules. And you, poor, doomed soul that you were, were going to be accompanying them to that terrible place as they took their act on the road. When you found out where you were heading you'd tried to make a break for it, only for Blood Queen to fly out, find you, and take you back to their house for some punishment. Melancholy had sat the punishment out and BQ said she was too tired from searching for you to do it herself, so she left the punishment to her two other band mates--

"Spike! Ob!" BQ called out, seeing her friends approach.

You heard the names, whirled around, and nearly dropped the speaker you were carrying in fear. At 13-feet-tall, the two anthro ladies were literal behemoths. Spike was a dragoness with crimson scales, two black horns protruded on both sides of her head, and her black hair was in a Mohawk. She was positively shredded, her muscles were displayed by a black shirt that was several sizes too small and with its sleeves ripped off, exposing her muscled arms and impressive six-pack. Her jeans were purposefully ripped at the knees. Spike was the guitarist of the group. She staggered as she walked, obviously drunk already. You gulped. Spike treated you like trash when she was drunk... she also did it while she was sober, but for some reason she was less creative in tortures then. Nearly every day since your purchase, she tormented or humiliated you in some way.

"You still not done, Roadie?" Spike slurred. "I wanted to be ready to hit the road by the time we got here!"

"I know," BQ said. "He's such a slacker."

Spike flashed a row of razor-sharp fangs. "Maybe I can light a fire under his ass?" She belched up a fireball that missed your feet by inches and set you working even harder. "There we go, that's what we're looking for. Ain't that right, Ob?"

Ob (short for Oubliette) only nodded, staring at you with her bulging yellow eyes, not helped by the excessive eye shadow she wore. Out of all of them, she scared you the most. She was a fox anthro who'd dyed all her fur a shade of neon green except for her white underbelly, and her black hair with streaks of violet. She wore a black top with a skull and crossbones on it, but it was stretched so tight across her chest, you were amazed it didn't snap under the pressure of her ample bosom. It also exposed an ample amount of cleavage. She wore a plaid, red and black skirt with fishnet stockings. While BQ was fairly chunky, Ob was completely obese. Her broad stomach was almost a perfect sphere, and it was so expansive it could easily fit three of you in there. She was the drummer of the group, and every time you saw her, she was always stuffing food past her black-painted lips, seemingly pulled from nowhere.

That was what terrified you most about her: her appetite. Sure she would participate in the humiliations BQ and Spike dished out on you, but it was the constant growling of her stomach whenever you were near that scared you beyond reason. She'd never spoken a word to you, but she always seemed to pop up behind you without a sound, looking at you as if you were the last slice of pizza she wanted to snatch up before someone else did. That look was still there when she saw you now.

Between Blood Queen's tyrannical orders, Spike's cruel pranks, and Oubliette's insatiable hunger, you dreaded the prospect of accompanying them to the Dark Lands, where your fate would be in their hands. Maybe Melancholy would be enough of a calming influence... but some you doubted it. You looked wistfully down the road, imagining making another break for it, but you knew it would be pointless. Soon the bus was loaded up and your mistresses were ready to go. Head hung low, you boarded the bus that would most likely spell your doom.
152.title: Non-Hyperbolic Death Metal

1521.content:
From your point of view, the tour bus you boarded was huge, but you knew it was positively puny by an anthro's point-of-view. Behind the driver's seat was a kitchen area and a bedroom area with a bathroom in-between. Sliding partitions could provide some privacy for the band members... for a given value of privacy. Thin black walls didn't exactly block out much noise.

They couldn't afford a professional chauffer so BQ sat in the driver's seat. Given her small size relative to her friends, she worked the pedals with two long stilts. The vampire bat drove like a psycho and every time you boarded the bus you feared for your life even more than usual. You gladly would've volunteered to act as their driver, for no other reason than to avoid spending time in the back with Spike and Ob, but BQ didn't trust you with her "precious baby." As you walked past her, she was cursing at her "precious baby" under her breath.

"Come on, come on you stupid hunk of junk," BQ muttered as she turned the key in the ignition.

The tour bus was notoriously temperamental. Unsurprising considering the old rust bucket looked like it'd been built several centuries ago and it spent most of its time hauling several tons worth of musical instruments and musicians from gig to gig. Secretly you prayed for the engine to never start. The tour bus finally breaking down might be your only way to avoid going to the Dark Lands. Unfortunately, like most of your prayers lately, it went ignored. The engine gave a jolt and roared to life. The bus lurched forward and you were sent tumbling forward.

Melly was sitting in a chair by the window reading a doorstopper of a book. The seat opposite her was occupied by her suitcase. Spike and Ob were seated on the other side of the bus from her in a semi-circle booth in the kitchen area. Both of them were so massive that they each took up a side to themselves, leaving only a little sliver of leather available. The dragoness was already chugging a fresh beer and the vixen was stuffing fistfuls of potato chips into her mouth from a bag the size of a sack. You felt her bulging yellow eyes on you and shivered. Spike noticed your fear and laughed.

"Sit down and take a load off, Roadie! There's a seat right here!" Spike patted the thin space between her and Ob and you immediately turned around to face Melly.

"Ms. Melancholy, may I please sit in that chair?"

Apparently puppy dog eyes can even work on a cat, since, after a long silence, she sighed and said, "Fine."

You were so relieved that you didn't even mind nearly breaking your back lifting her suitcase off the chair and planting it on the floor. You heaved a sigh of relief as you sat down. A few minutes of pleasant boredom passed as you watched the scenery pass by. You caught a good look at the book in Melly's hands: a dusty tome as big as a phonebook that looked like it belonged in either a museum or a haunted house. Then the pleasant boredom just became regular boredom. Melly was obviously engrossed in her book. Your curiosity got the better of you and it was then you asked the seemingly innocuous words that would change your life forever.

"What are you reading?"

"A spell book."

The others heard her and laughed.

"Come on, Melly," Blood Queen called from the driver's seat, "I like the occult as much as anyone, but don't tell me you actually believe in magic?"

"Of course I do," Melly said boredly. "After all, I've done some."

She said it so casually that everyone laughed even louder and harder. Even you couldn't help but giggle, though you quickly shut up when Melly glared at you.

"Jeez, Mel, I always thought you were the straight man in this group," BQ said. She swerved to avoid something on the road--another car, from the blaring horn--and screeched like the bat she was. "RIGHT-OF-WAY, ASSHOLE!"

"It's true. I've done magic in the past. Nothing major, but enough to see if it's for real. I want to incorporate it into our shows to save us money on practical effects during our shows. I've already levitated some things."

"Oh yeah?" BQ asked. "Prove it. Do some magic. Levitate something right here."

"Magic is unpredictable," Melly said, sounding uncertain for the first time. "I don't want to make a mistake and destroy something valuable--"

"Then test it out on the roadie!" Spike chipped in. "He's the least valuable thing here!"

Blood Queen snickered. "Sure, why not? Try out your non-existent levitation spell on him. I'm game. How about you Ob?" The vixen looked at you and shrugged. "See? It's decided!"

"Wait," you sputtered. "You're, uh--you're joking right?"

"Why so scared, roadie?" Melly asked coldly. "You don't believe in magic either, right?"

You were really regretting asking her about her book now. You were regretting laughing at her claims of magic even more. Apparently she took it personally. You didn't get time to argue against her though, as she pointed a claw at you and started reading from the book. You tried to tell yourself that nothing would happen, that there was no such thing as magic, and the weird tingling spreading over your body was just your imagination. You kept telling yourself that as Melancholy's voice raised in volume, growing louder and louder until she finished in an echoing crescendo.

What happens to you?

1) Melancholy's magic is a success and you levitate!

2) The spell goes horribly wrong and you end up shrinking!

3) The spell goes horribly wrong in some other entertaining and implausible way!
1521.title: Tour Bus... of DOOM!

choices: Melly gets to keep you...for now.
15212.content:
Melly gave a final dramatic gesture, jabbing her claw at you—you could swear you saw a faint glow on her claw…

You feel as if you’re falling. Fast.
Spike yelps.
Ob splutters something you don’t hear.

Fear and vertigo clamp down and everything goes black, but you hear one thing loud and clear before you go under.

It’s Melly’s voice, and one word.
“Oops…”

===

Your head is pounding, everything hurts, and you feel like you got hit by a truck. Whatever Melly’s spell did—it sure as hell didn’t levitate you—it did a number on you. Sitting up with a groan, you rub your temples until the pain dulls to something bearable and the spots clear from behind your eyelids. You open your eyes…

“AAAAAAHHHHH!”
You flatten against the floor, babbling in terror and cringe away.

Four huge, terrifying somethings loomed over you like shadows of death itself. Inescapable, all-encompassing; unholy. This had to be Hell.

One of the things spoke. In Spike’s voice.
“Well, Roadie’s alive at least.”

You scramble back and hit your head on…a glass wall? You look back to behold a giant soda bottle. You look around, horror dawning. There was a pile of magazines, an ashtray, and the bag of chips Spike had been eating—you look at the “floor” and find it’s the table in the bus’ kitchen--suddenly gigantic. Just like your four mistresses.

This wasn’t hell. It was WORSE: the tour bus, and you were bug-sized.
“WHAT DID YOU DO TO ME?!” You wail, embarrassed at how squeaky your voice sounded.

“Melly shrank you, duh,” BQ answered, rolling her eyes. The bat gave her bandmate a look. “Turns out magic is real after all…but easy to screw up.”

Melancholy hissed. “Is ‘I was wrong’ so hard to say, Miss Skeptic?” She looks at you and purrs. “Your proof is right here.”

“But it DIDN’T WORK,” Ob countered. “He was supposed to float, and he shrank. Either magic doesn’t work, or you can’t read that creepy book of yours.”

Melly bared her fangs. “It just takes practice. You want to join Roadie?”

“You think you can take me, kitty-cat?” Ob growls, taking a boxing stance. The two titans look ready to throw down--

BQ's hand slammed down on the table, very close to you. The sound is like a cannon shot, the impact bone-shaking. “Girls! Simmer down, we’re adults. We have something more important to worry about: how to deal with Roadie. Because of that spell, he’s of no use, unless we perform for an anthill.”

“We paid good money for our human; we can’t just let him go to waste,” Ob pointed out. “Maybe we shouldn’t just get rid of him. Protecting investments and whatnot.”

“But he’s even more useless now than before!” BQ objected.. “Look at him, he’s the size of a grain of rice! It’s best we just eat him.”

You whimpered and tried to babble out a plea for mercy, but the quartet ignored you.

“Been a while since I ate a human,” Spike muses, fanged tongue licking her scaly lips. “Last time was when I was a kid…and hey, dragons gotta have some fresh meat now and again!”

Ob’s hands slapped her hips. “I’ve heard some of the really big anthros—like, hundred feet or so--like to sit on humans. Always wanted to try that…sound nice, Roadie? You wanna be under a big foxy booty? Wonder if he’ll just go splat, or survive a bit.”

Melly meowed, leaning closer. Her giant feline face is inches from yours, filling your view. “Girls…he’s kind of cute at this size, I…I wanna cuddle him! Besides, maybe I can undo the spell and get him back to normal. Unless we decide to keep him like this for good, of course. I can look after him, since he’s no use for road work like this. You wanna be Melly’s pet, sweetie?” She added, giving you a sweet smile totally at odds with her stage name and usual demeanor.

“Hmm…you say you can change him back?” BQ asked, stroking her chin and eyeing you like a broken clock she was on the fence about fixing.

Melly shrugged. “Maybe. Depends on what went wrong with the spell. Once I figure that out, then I’ll know if the shrinkage is permanent or not. If it is, then one of you can have him. But until then…I say let me keep him.”

“Why wait, though?” Spike asked, looking at you hungrily.

All you can do is whimper. What would these sadistic women do to you?
15212.title: The Not So Incredible Shrinking Human

152121.content:
You knew going into the Dark Lands was a death sentence but you didn't expect it to kill you so fast! In the space of several seconds after shrinking two of your owners expressed a desire to eat you, one of them to sit on you, and only one wanted to spare your life merely to keep you as a pet. How you longed for a few hours ago when you didn't think your situation could get any worse. Back before you were the size of a potato chip.

"Alright!" BQ said, raising her voice above her fellow band mates. "I'm the leader and I've come to a decision!"

"Wait a minute," Spike growled. "We all pitched in for him, we should all get a vote--"

"Do you really think anyone other than you is going to vote in favor of you eating him?" BQ asked. The dragoness crossed her arms and huffed, literally letting off some steam from her nostrils. "That's what I thought," the vampire bat said smugly. "Look, girls, I get it. Roadie's shrinking accident has opened up a world of possibilities now that he's even more worthless than usual. If I'm being honest, I wouldn't mind a small snack myself." Her eyes fell onto your miniscule form and her stomach audibly growled. It took visible effort for her to get back on track. "But even a puny runt like this was a significant investment, and eating him, or crushing him, or torturing him in any way--while fucking hilarious--would also mean we blew our money on a one-time-play-session, and I'm not in the habit of wasting money!"

You dared yourself to hope. BQ's cheapskate tendencies have caused you more than a little turmoil over the course of your servitude but now it looked like it might actually save your life. Go figure.

"Now, we need a slave more than we need a snack or a toy, so until Melly says he's stuck like this, she'll be the one to keep an eye on him. Any questions?"

Spike and Ob muttered, "Fine," like a pair of sullen teenagers who weren't getting a new phone and BQ handed you over to Melancholy.

"Here you go, Mel. Work your magic."

Melancholy couldn't stop herself from letting out a purr of happiness. A smile lit up her face and you were genuinely surprised to see it there. She always seemed so cold and aloof. Apparently pathetic things were cute in her eyes.

"Thanks, Bonnie! You won't regret this!" You gasped as she raised you to her face and began rubbing you against her cheek affectionately, cuddling you aggressively. "Oh, he's so widdle and cuuuuuuuute! I just wanna pway wif him fowevah!"

"Oh for the love of Pete," BQ growled. "Don't grow getting attached to him now! He's a slave, not a pet. I bought him so a human would take care of me, not the other way around. The second you say you can't turn him back, his ass is grass. Heck, if I even catch you playing with him instead of working on a cure, I'll eat him myself! You hear me, Pussy Cat?"

Melly hissed and spat at the hated nickname.

"I'll take that as a yes. Now, enough distractions. Thanks to that little shrimp, we're behind schedule and I'm gonna have to drive all night to make up the time! So if one of you screws something up, keep it to yourselves."

"Why did we ever make her leader?" Spike muttered as she watched her go.

Ob shrugged. "Cause she owns the bus?"

"Right," the dragoness said, scratching her shredded stomach. She looked at you regretfully. "Oh well. Looks like human isn't back on the menu... at the moment," she said, flashing her fangs.

You gulped.

"Don't worry," Melly confided in you as she walked to the rooms in the back, her suitcase in her other hand. "I won't let any of those big brutes harm a widdle hair on your pwecious, widdle head."

"Ms. Melancholy!" you said loudly, hoping to talk some sense into her. "You need to change me back! They'll kill me otherwise!"

"No they won't, my little Roadie. Cause they'd have to get through me first." Her declaration did not inspire as much confidence in her as she thought. "Now, let's get you out of those clothes and into something more comfortable."

"WHAT?!"

=== Five Minutes Later ===

"This is so degrading," you muttered as you inspected yourself in the mirror. Apparently Melly hadn't just packed clothes for the trip. Inside the very suitcase you'd be forced to move to sit across from her was a huge dollhouse designed like a gothic manor, complete with fully dressed, eerie-faced dolls that looked like they could star in a horror movie. She'd removed the black, stuffy, Victorian-esque suit off of one of them and hastily put it onto you. You looked like a microscopic butler. Despite your reduced size, they were still small and tight on you, coming up past your knees and wrists.

As if I don't have enough to worry about, you thought bitterly, now I need to be afraid these dolls will come to life when I sleep and murder me for taking their friends clothes.

"It fits perfect!" Melly squealed, seeing you dressed up for the first time.

You face-palmed. "Ms. Melancholy," you said, trying to be patient, "you need to focus. You need to turn me back so I can get back to work." Man, you never thought that'd be a sentence you'd willingly utter in your life. "Can we please start looking for a cure?"

"We don't need to start looking through that dusty spellbook right away, do we?" Melancholy said playfully. "Surely we have plenty of time for one or two games!"

This was a side to Melly you'd never seen before. Sure, she seemed "nicer" than your other mistresses--not that she'd ever had to try particularly hard there--but she definitely never gave off a "warm hugs and kisses" kind of vibe. She always seemed so dark and serious, and now, the one time you needed her to be stoic and in control, she wanted to play with you like you were her pet. You needed to convince her otherwise. Blood Queen's warning was still fresh in your mind. If she caught Melly playing with you instead of working on a cure, she'd eat you without a second thought.

Can you convince Melancholy to start researching a cure or will she play some "games" with you?
152121.title: Stay of Execution

choices: Stick with Iris and her human on the job.
1522.content:
Black ski mask? Check.

Black sweat pants? Check.

Black tunic? Check.

You tug and play around with your uniform a few more times in the mirror, keeping your eyes exercised for any gaps of skin that could be noticeable on a dark summer night, and grin in satisfaction. It’d be a good night, you could feel. Yes, Iris would be pleased.

Scanning over your mental checklist one last time, double checking that your uniform, mind, and body were all up to the test, you give a triumphant nod and run over to the balcony of your manor’s bedroom; indeed, probably a human from the ancient times would’ve envied a man to possess enough expensive jewelry, housing, and furniture to be bored of, and especially any of the rare, rare humans living near extinction today would have slaughtered to sleep in a bed as big as yours was; to think it was all due to the generosity of an anthro, of all things.

Not that you needed them, really, just the fact that they were all marks of approval. Blessings from a goddess, one of the few anthros alive who deserved to call themselves such.

The nighttime’s darkness bleeds into the canopy of Iris’s tent, the living space illuminated by candles periodically hung from the supporting poles. The fruit bat woman’s home had flair to match hers onstage; plenty of colorful, flowing blankets that curtained her bed, bottles of doctor good everywhere that hung on poles, and tons of mirrors, giving her every possible chance she’d desire to mirth over her own beauty.

...and speaking of, your goddess was busy abusing her most favorite one. That is, her only one, as of now, and likely due to succumb the fate of many others that’d been abandoned before in the dirt, tangled amongst articles of clothing that couldn’t match the rate of her nightly feasting. It’s not to say Iris was ever a thin woman before you and her met; heck, had she been as large as you were, she would’ve clocked in a good three hundred pounds, maybe six hundred several months after when the profits of her shows allowed her to double in on her gluttony, but after her appetite finally pulled the bottom brick, when the obtusely round fruit-bat lady you knew today really began to take form, she blew up at a rate that no scale or medical book could compare her weight to, any skeleton or definition beneath her globular physique “reduced” to but a forever inflating balloon with but four obscenely obese limbs to give her any remaining form.

Abnormally wide, stretching shoulders and arms accommodated her towering stature, dwarving even most of the fattest anthros that you’d seen in her audiences, but her vertical build never drew the scale of hips that outmatched what her hands could reach, bloated buttocks so large that they were always visible in her form, regardless of where she was facing, but were always curtained in front by a stomach so immense that it always mashed generously on wherever her feet stood, too heavy to lift from its expansive perch on the ground without several strongmen to keep it carried, yet structured underneath by enough muscle (or food, in many cases) that it surged off of her in a pronounced ball as opposed to sag around in a shapeless mass, thick, meaty rolls sitting on her hips while her ever-abundant bosom rested comfortably on its massive perch.

Dressed in a burgundy shawl wrapped to keep her breasts contained, a toga-like fashion of blankets that clothed what little of her legs she could reach, and a silken cap which a river of wavy brown hair drooped from its rear, black pointed ears poking through slits cut into the fabric, all Iris had left to do was stretch and work our her mouth, her maw vaguely akin to a wolf’s that was shrouded by pitch black fur. At the joint of your door squeaking slightly, one of her ears swiveled your way, and she went still before craning her head towards your little enclosure. Wringing out her flabby arms, her leathery wings flaring out briefly, she lumbered over to your corner, her feet landing in large, thunderous quakes that tested the nails and walls keeping your house together. A fearful premonition to some, but you welcomed it now, having attributed it to the fact that she was near.
